About the job Arbury Court/St Mary’s Hospital, Warrington  As a Consultant Psychiatrist or Consultant Forensic Psychiatrist, do you have experience working with male patients who have complex mental health and neurological care needs? Or are you passionate about the complex mental health care of women in a secure setting? If so, we have the perfect opportunity at Elysium Healthcare.  As the Consultant Psychiatrist, you will be responsible for delivering care programmes and providing individualised approaches to the treatment of inpatients. The role is for either one successful full-time candidate to work 10 sessions a week spilt evenly between the two services, Or for two part-time candidates who each wish to work for 5 sessions in one of the services. The role includes second on-call duties (currently 1 in 16 for full-time consultants) where you will have junior-level support every day.  The two services, St Mary’s Hospital and Arbury Court, are both situated close to Liverpool, Manchester, Chester and surrounding areas, making both hospitals highly commutable. St Mary’s provides specialist inpatient care primarily for men with Acquired Brain Injuries (ABI) in medium and low secure settings. Arbury Court provides a full specialised inpatient care pathway for adult women with a wide range of mental health difficulties in medium and low security, as well as a psychiatric intensive care (PICU) setting.  Joining Elysium Healthcare, you will feel valued and supported, enjoy excellent CPD with development opportunities, work in a rewarding environment and highly competitive salary and package.  To learn more about the role, please contact Ellie Atkinson, please click Apply Now.

company: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust
details: About the job Post-COVID Syndrome Service  Primary Care Psychological Therapy (IAPT) Division, GMMH  Psychological Wellbeing Practitioner  In response to the ongoing healthcare needs reported by a proportion of people subsequent to infection with COVID-19, a national five point plan has been published which includes the development of bespoke care pathways to complement existing primary, community and rehabilitation services. Commonly occurring ongoing difficulties include: fatigue, breathlessness, joint and muscle pain, common mental health problems, chest pain, insomnia, and loneliness.  We have developed a service pathway for the population to address these needs. The pathway is designed to provide a consistent destination to meet the needs of people living with PCS, many of whom will be at the end of sensible acute medical care, but still living with significant functional limitation.  If you would like to find out more about this exciting development please contact Hassaan.karajada@gmmh.nhs.uk  We need enthusiastic and able professionals, committed to working in a person-centred way, to promote optimal self-management, reinforce helpful illness beliefs and behaviour, and help alleviate the unnecessary suffering which shadows depression, crippling anxiety, persistent pain and fatigue. This role is an essential part of the multi-disciplinary team, the skill mix chosen to ensure we can collectively help make a positive difference and alleviate the deleterious impact of PCS on life-choices and -trajectories.  The service clinical skill-mix consists of a Clinical Health Psychologist, Operational Manager, Pharmacist, Neuropsychologist and Consultant Psychiatrist, Psychological Therapists, Psychological Wellbeing Practitioners and a Cognitive Behavioural Therapist. Working practices will involve a combination of remote and place-based delivery, dependent on service user choice and clinical need.  Greater Manchester Mental Health (GMMH) Foundation Trust employs over 6,400 members of staff, who deliver services from more than 160 locations.  We provide inpatient and community-based mental health care for people living in Bolton, the city of Manchester, Salford, Trafford and the borough of Wigan, and a wide range of specialist mental health and substance misuse services across Greater Manchester, the north west of England and beyond.  Greater Manchester is one of the world's most innovative, original and exciting places to live and work. From the beauty of the surrounding countryside to the heart of the vibrant inner city with great shopping, entertainment and dining options.  Wherever you go you will experience a great northern welcome with people famed for their warmth, humour and generosity.  Our people enjoy their work, have opportunities to learn and develop their skills and are encouraged to generate new ideas that improve care for our service users.  We are aspiring to ensure our workforce is representative of the diverse communities that we serve, and we are strongly committed to removing barriers to employment for candidates from under-represented groups, for example BAME, Disabled and LGBT+ communities. If you would like to have an informal chat about the recruitment process for this role or would value some additional support, we’d love to hear from you.  Please contact Denise Gleave, Recruitment & Retention Advisor 0161 358 1448 or email denise.gleave@gmmh.nhs.uk  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Hassaan Karajada Job title: Operational Manager Email address: hassaan.karajada@gmmh.nhs.uk

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Job Title: Locum Consultant Child and Adolescent Mental Health Psychiatrist Job Description: As a Locum Consultant Child and Adolescent Mental Health Psychiatrist, you will provide expert psychiatric care and support to children and adolescents with mental health conditions. You will work on a temporary or contract basis, filling in for absent or vacant positions within hospitals, clinics, or mental health facilities. Your role will involve comprehensive assessment, diagnosis, treatment planning, and therapeutic interventions to promote the well-being and recovery of young individuals. Responsibilities: Clinical Assessment and Diagnosis: Conduct thorough psychiatric assessments and evaluations of children and adolescents to determine the presence of mental health disorders. Utilise interviews, observations, and psychological tests to gather information on symptoms, psychosocial factors, and developmental considerations. Formulate accurate diagnoses based on DSM-5 or ICD-10 criteria. Treatment Planning and Implementation: Develop individualised treatment plans in collaboration with the patient, their families, and the multidisciplinary team. Utilise evidence-based pharmacological interventions and psychotherapeutic approaches to address mental health conditions. Monitor treatment efficacy, adjust medication dosages, and provide ongoing therapeutic interventions as required. Medication Management: Prescribe, monitor, and manage psychotropic medications for children and adolescents with mental health disorders. Conduct regular medication reviews, assess treatment response, and manage potential side effects or complications. Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure holistic care and coordinate any necessary changes in medication regimens. Psychotherapy and Counselling: Provide individual, family, and group psychotherapy and counselling sessions. Utilise evidence-based modalities such as cognitive-behavioural therapy, dialectical behaviour therapy, or psychodynamic therapy to address specific mental health needs. Support patients in developing coping skills, managing emotions, and improving overall functioning. Crisis Intervention and Risk Assessment: Respond to psychiatric emergencies and provide crisis intervention for children and adolescents in acute distress. Conduct comprehensive risk assessments, develop safety plans, and coordinate appropriate interventions to ensure the safety and well-being of patients. Collaborate with emergency services or crisis teams as necessary. Collaborative Care and Consultation: Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, including psychologists, social workers, nurses, and occupational therapists, to provide comprehensive care to patients. Consult and provide guidance to colleagues regarding complex cases, treatment options, and management strategies. Participate in case conferences and multidisciplinary team meetings. Documentation and Record-Keeping: Maintain accurate and detailed medical records, including assessment findings, treatment plans, progress notes, and medication management. Ensure compliance with legal and ethical standards, maintaining confidentiality and privacy of patient information. Continuous Professional Development: Stay updated with the latest research, guidelines, and advancements in child and adolescent psychiatry. Attend relevant conferences, workshops, and training programs to enhance knowledge and skills. Engage in continuous professional development activities to provide the highest quality of care. Qualifications and Requirements:-Medical degree (MBBS/MD) with specialisation in Psychiatry. Completion of specialty training in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry. Board certification or eligibility in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry. Valid license to practice medicine and psychiatry in the relevant jurisdiction. Proven experience as a Consultant Psychiatrist in Child and Adolescent Mental Health settings. In-depth knowledge of child and adolescent psychiatric disorders, diagnostic criteria, and evidence-based treatment modalities. Proficiency in pharmacological interventions for mental health conditions in children and adolescents. Strong clinical assessment and diagnostic skills. Experience in providing psychotherapy and counselling to children and adolescents. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills. Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team and collaborate with other healthcare professionals. Adherence to professional ethics and confidentiality guidelines. Flexibility and adaptability to work on a locum basis. Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary contract Contract length: 3-6 months Salary: £90.00-£120.00 per hour Benefits: Referral programme Ability to commute/relocate: Edgware, HA8 0AD: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required) Licence/Certification: GMC (required) Work Location: In person

About the job Job Summary  In line with New Ways of Working and the changing role of the Consultant, the post holder will provide a consultative, supervisory and supportive role to the multi-disciplinary team.  Main duties of the job  The post holder will take an active part in the clinical work of the team; the majority of clinical work is based on site, but service users may also be seen at home, as required. Clinical work also includes report writing and attendance at Mental Health Act review tribunals.  About Us  Mersey Care is one of the largest trusts providing physical health and mental health services in the North West, serving more than 11 million people.  We offer specialist inpatient and community services that support physical and mental health and specialist inpatient mental health, learning disability, addiction and brain injury services. Mersey Care is one of only three trusts in the UK that offer high secure mental health facilities.  At the heart of all we do is our commitment to 'perfect care' - care that is safe, effective, positively experienced, timely, equitable and efficient. We support our staff to do the best job they can and work alongside service users, their families, and carers to design and develop future services together. We're currently delivering a programme of organisational and service transformation to significantly improve the quality of the services we provide and safely reduce cost as we do so.  Job Description  Job responsibilities  The consultant will have RC responsibility for patients under CTO. We have currently got 27 patients on CTO. The case load of current CTO is divided with the current recovery team consultant and the rest between a community and inpatient consultant who have RC responsibility for the CTO patients.  Person Specification  Essential  QUALIFICATIONS AND TRAINING  MbChb, MBBS or equivalent Clinical skills, knowledge and experience  Essential  Excellent knowledge in specialty Excellent clinical skills using bio-psycho-social perspective and wide medical knowledge Excellent oral and written communication skills in English Academic skills and lifelong learning  Essential  Able to deliver undergraduate or postgraduate teaching and training Participated in continuous professional development Participated in research or service evaluation. Able to use and appraise clinical evidence. Has actively participated in clinical audit.  Any attachments will be accessible after you click to apply.  BMJ-111206/350-MED4206303-G

company: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
details: About the job We are looking to appoint an enthusiastic Consultant Psychiatrist on a substantive basis as part of our comprehensive CAMHS Service in North Derbyshire.  Based in the Buxton, the team covering the High Peak and Dales. This area is a mix of towns and villages and so has a varied population including farmers and other rural workers as well as commuters.  The team comprises of a team lead, psychologist, mental health practitioners and an ANP, as well regular input from CBT therapists and the family therapist for the service. Additionally, there is DBT available at the Buxton base from the DBT team  The Buxton base is easily commutable from both Sheffield, Chesterfield and Manchester.  The Child and Adolescent Mental Health Service (CAMHS) provides specialist mental health services to a population of approximately 77,000 children. The service has 2 generic tier 3 teams, a Community Advisors Team, an Urgent Care Team, an Eating Disorders Team, an Intensive Home Treatment Team, DBT team and an LD CAMHS team.  There are 6 consultant psychiatrists and 2 Specialty Doctors across the service. They function as a strong supportive group. There is good support from a growing team of advanced nurse prescribers.  The successful Candidate will possess excellent interpersonal skills and have a flexible approach. You will be a team player who enjoy working in a multi-disciplinary setting with highly experienced and skilled staff while being capable of providing clinical leadership for the team.  Please see the attached the Job Description and Person Specification which gives details regarding the job role, and also contact details should you wish to discuss any aspect of the job.  Chesterfield Royal Hospital is a friendly District General Hospital with the beautiful Peak District on its doorstep. This post presents a great opportunity to live and work in some of the finest landscape this country has to offer.  The CAMHS service is part of the Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust which also benefits from co-location of comprehensive paediatric services, (paediatricians, paediatric ward, community therapists and nurses) and the disabled children’s social care team. The CAMHS team enjoy highly positive relationships with paediatrics.  Major cities such as Sheffield, Leeds, Nottingham and Derby are all within an hour’s train journey, and local airports include East Midlands, Manchester and Leeds Bradford, with London within a couple of hours drive.  There are excellent schools in the local area, only a few minutes from the hospital, as well as nursery childcare on-site.  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Mr Chris Emlen Job title: Service Manager Email address: c.emblen@nhs.net

company: Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
details: About the job Applications are invited for the post of Consultant in Liaison Psychiatry (Psychological Medicine) in the Psychological Medicine Service of Oxford University Hospitals, a large acute Foundation Trust.  The Psychological Medicine Service is part of the Oxford Psychological Medicine Centre, an internationally recognised centre for service, teaching and research in the integration of psychiatry and psychology into medical care.  The appointee will work alongside a large number of psychiatrists and psychologists, who are integrated into medical teams across the Trust. The specialty area for this post will be predominantly in maternity services, but there is scope to work in other areas the our service covers in parallel to maternity, and in due course other specialties too.  This is a Trust appointment with a base at the John Radcliffe Hospital site.  The appointment is on a whole-time basis. However applications are welcome from those who wish to job share. Any person who is unable for personal reasons to work full-time will also be considered eligible to apply for the post. If such a person is appointed, modification of the job content will be discussed on a personal basis in consultation with consultant colleagues.  This post would suit a psychiatrist with a CCT in adult psychiatry or a dual CCT in adult and old age psychiatry and experience of working in an acute hospital setting. An endorsement in liaison psychiatry is not essential.  Senior trainees in the final months of their training are eligible to apply.  Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust is one of the largest NHS teaching trusts in the country and a leading international Academic Health Science Centre. It provides an extensive range of general and specialist clinical services and is a base for medical education, training and research.  There are plentiful opportunities for professional and academic education and training. There are many relevant academic and educational meetings in the general hospitals and university which the post-holder will be welcome to attend.  The post-holder will have the opportunity to collaborate with academic colleagues on relevant clinical research projects.  The post-holder’s contribution to and time allocation for teaching, training and research will be included in regular job plan reviews. The teaching and support of medical and nursing staff in the provision of psychiatric assessment and care is a major part of the role.  The Trust is committed to be an active partner in healthcare innovation, research and workforce education, with the aim of forming an effective bridge between research in basic science and in healthcare service provision, and the delivery of evidence-based, best practice care, turning today's discoveries into tomorrow's care.  This vision is underpinned by the Trust's founding partnership with the University of Oxford.  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Dr. Remy Flechais Job title: Clinical Lead for Psychiatry Email address: remy.flechais@ouh.nhs.uk Telephone number: 01865 223153  Shortlisted applicants are advised to visit.

About the job Pennine Care NHS Foundation Trust  CONSULTANT IN OLDER PEOPLE PSYCHIATRY  Tameside- 10PAs  Pennine Care NHS Foundation Trust is looking to recruit a full-time substantive Consultant Psychiatrist. This post is based in Tameside and the service here operates in a sectorised model and is staffed by 3 wte sector Consultants in Older People Psychiatry and 1 wte in Memory Services and Older People Liaison. Each Consultant is allocated a Junior Doctor (NW Deanery training schemes) to work with them  This is an exciting time to join the Trust and there are many opportunities to contribute to the organisations’ development and to look at service redesign models. Tameside has a very strong teaching commitment and candidates will be expected to contribute to the teaching of medical and nursing staff and 4th medical students. There are close links with ongoing research projects. The Consultants contribute to local service user & carer groups.  To provide high-quality Mental Health Care for older people with severe and enduring mental health problems both inpatient and outpatients.  To work closely with other teams and Consultants to ensure coherent and high-quality mental health care for older people with severe and enduring mental health problems within the Tameside area.  To work with the other Consultants to support the development of the service, and to attend local and divisional service development meetings.  Applicants must be on the GMC’s Specialist Register or eligible for inclusion or be within six months’ of the anticipated award of a Certificate of Completion of Training (CCT) in Older People Psychiatry at the time of interview for the post.  We offer ample opportunities for our consultants’ professional development and opportunities for additional work for additional PAs (require negotiation).  We are proud to provide high quality mental health and learning disability services, both inpatient and in the community across five boroughs of Greater Manchester - Bury, Oldham, Rochdale, Stockport and Tameside and Glossop.  Our vision is for a happier and more hopeful life for everyone in our communities and our staff work hard to deliver the very best care for the people who use our services. We’re really proud of our #PennineCarePeople and do everything we can to make sure we’re a great place to work.  All individuals regardless of race, age, disability, ethnicity, nationality, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marriage and civil partnership are encouraged to apply for this post. We would also encourage applications from individuals with a lived experience of mental illness, either individually or as a carer.  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Dr Elizabeth Elvin Job title: Clinical Director - Tameside & Glossop Email address: elizabeth.elvin@nhs.net Telephone number: 0161 716 3252

company: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust
details: About the job Consultant Psychiatrist In Substance Misuse Services  We are delighted to seek applications for our Specialist Directorate for a Consultant Psychiatrist.  You will be predominantly based on the Edward Myers Unit, Harplands Hospital.  The role will consist of 10 PAs as a Consultant Psychiatrist in Substance Misuse Services, and you will engage with the development of your Job Plan.  We look forward to hearing from potential applicants and would welcome the opportunity to discuss the role further.  Carry out new referral assessments, deliver therapy or refer to colleagues for relevant interventions, or to follow up patients for medication reviews.  Formulate care and treatment plans, prescribe various types of treatment, and provide guidance on evidence-based treatment and effectiveness. Actively support patients and their families, communicating clinical information to explain a diagnosis and treatment options using various methods to ensure practical understanding. Communicate with patients and the wider multidisciplinary team on shared patient decision making. Work in and where appropriate, lead a multidisciplinary team. Assess and prioritise patient/client requirements, delegating effectively to others. Recognise, review, and report a patient's condition and any changes to the patient and the multidisciplinary team. Performing basic administrative and clerical tasks, such as keeping records of test results, writing prescriptions, providing information to patients, and monitoring treatment plans. Help teach and train other junior doctors and medical students and other multidisciplinary team members.  AWARDED "TRUST OF THE YEAR"  North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare Trust is a great place to work and has a sound future as a leading provider of excellent services. In recent months we have restructured our services to embed and drive forward an integrated, locality based model of care providing a patient centred provision of support and treatment.  In return for your commitment our Trust offers a friendly and supportive environment. You will be provided with your own office and administrative support to your role. The Trust has free parking and a flexible relocation package. We are able to support commuting with flexible hours and have remote working in place which can facilitate working from other bases including home where this meets the needs of the service.  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Jalibani Ndbele Job title: Associate Director Email address: jalibani.ndebele@combined.nhs.uk

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more An exciting job opportunity has arisen for a dedicated General Adult Consultant Psychiatrist to work in an exceptional hospital service based in the Royston, Hertfordshire. You will be working for one of UK's leading health care providers  This hospital offers purpose-built services with medium secure, low secure, and both locked and open rehabilitation opportunities. They offer a range of specialist recovery pathways, all at one site  To hold and continue registration with the GMC including the relevant Specialist Register**  As The Psychiatrist Your Key Responsibilities Include  Taking clinical responsibility for patients, including multidisciplinary ward rounds, risk reviews, strategic reviews and the development of a therapeutic milieu Fulfilling the role of Responsible Clinician to patients detained under the Mental Health Act (1983) Supervising the process of referral and admission including contributing to preadmission assessments of young people with other team members Offering a psychiatric perspective to the multidisciplinary team in relation to the assessment, formulation and treatment of young people Contributing to management meetings and clinical governance meetings for the services provided at the hospital, and contributing to the development of service strategy Contributing to in-house training programmes within the services and offering supervision to other members of the multi-disciplinary team, particularly junior medical staff Maintaining CPD and re-validation requirements, as determined by the Royal College of Psychiatrists or other relevant statutory bodies  The following skills and experience would be preferred and beneficial for the role:  Good team player Keen to participate in a multidisciplinary approach to assessment, formulation and management plans Experience in working Rehabilitation Services with patients with mental illness, substance misuse, and complex needs Experience in neuropsychiatry, learning disability, and Autism desirable Excellent skills in working in groups, communication and knowledge base for this service  Benefits  In return for your hard work and commitment you will receive the following generous benefits  The successful Psychiatrist will receive an excellent salary of £135,471.48 per annum. This exciting position is a Full Time role working 37.5 hours a week. Monthly Car Allowance of £612.50** Up to 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays Free parking at every site Health and wellbeing support through our EAP (Employee Assistance Programme) Pension scheme with a Priory contribution SMART Pensions - Opt for a slightly smaller salary and we pay an extra contribution into your pension. The result? We both save on National Insurance payments and you end up with an overall increase in your take-home pay Cycle scheme - Get a tax-free bike with equipment and pay monthly from your salary, generating a cost saving of up to 42% Computing scheme - Buy the latest technology at no more than the RRP using salary exchange whilst spreading the cost over 12 months Our shopping discount site where you'll find great offers for online and in-store shopping, negotiated specially for everyone who works with us GymFlex - Spread the cost of an annual gym membership over 12 months and use your membership at health clubs, leisure centres, boot camps and yoga studios across the UK Reference ID: 3378  To apply for this fantastic job role, please call on 0121 638 0567 or send your CV

About the job The undergraduate medical education team is responsible for managing training programmes for medical students from two universities.  The main focus of this role is to liaise with the universities and Trust education leads to deliver high quality undergraduate medical education programmes within the Trust.  This post will be responsible for organising timetables for students from Warwick Medical School, ensuring students can meet their educational needs, and to act as a first point of contact for queries.  You will need to have good communication skills, a high level of accuracy and attention to detail, and to be able to work as part of the wider team. There will be a requirement to work flexibly during the exam period.  To assist the Undergraduate Education team in the provision of Undergraduate services for medical students.  To assist in the development of the course.  Be a point of contact for medical students on a day to day basis escalating matters to other members of the team as appropriate.  Come and join a Trust rated Outstanding by the CQC. South Warwickshire NHS Foundation Trust have been rated as outstanding following our latest inspection by the CQC and we are recruiting new staff to come and help us improve even further.  We provide services across Warwickshire and beyond ranging from Hospitals in Warwick, Stratford-Upon-Avon, Royal Leamington Spa and Shipston-on Stour to Community Services across the county. We are a progressive, expanding organisation with great ambition around improving quality, integrating pathways and delivering high levels of productivity.  Our values can be summed up in one sentence. We are ‘Trusted to provide safe, effective and compassionate care’. Throughout the recruitment process you will be asked to think about how you demonstrate these values and how they impact on your work. It doesn’t matter what role you do, whether it is patient facing or not, we are all working in the same way with our values at the core.  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Robert Knell Job title: Postgraduate Medical Education Manager Email address: Robert.Knell@swft.nhs.uk Telephone number: 01926 495321  Ext. 4324

About the job Robinson Medical Recruitment is seeking a professional Care Assistant for an exciting role in the East End of Glasgow.  As an HCA with RMR, We can offer you fully flexible working, which in turn gives you a better work and lifestyle balance, allowing you to find time for what matters most to you. Whether you want full or part-time hours, there’s a position to suit you.  About This Care Assistant Job  You will be responsible for a range of tasks, designed to help service users live as independently as possible. These tasks will include assisting with social activities, personal care, clinical requirements and any other additional services required.  The right healthcare assistant for this role will be dedicated to promoting the well-being and quality of life for each person they care for. This means, recognising the capabilities of the individual and championing their needs and getting to know each person beyond their care plan.  The important stuff!  We are looking for an exceptional care assistant who has a real pass for making a difference with the care you provide. We do require a minimum of 6 months of paid experience in a carehome setting within the last 12 months in the UK. As a HCA you should have a current SSSC registration or at least be commited to join when you become a RMR employee. Having access to a a car or transport is desirable for the role due to attending to various locations. Ideally able to commit to at least 2-3 shifts a week. Dementia and care of elderley experience is hugely essential! if you hold a SVQ Level 2 then perfect as that is always desireable!  The Benefits!  As a RMR employee we can offer you excellent pay rates including holiday pay, We cover the cost of your PVG update and provide you with free uniform, regular incentive and referral bonus scheme. Not only that, we can offer you endless training and development to support you in your career and 24 hour support from your very own co-ordinator. Lastly, an online timesheet process for smooth payments!  Why work with RMR?  RMR is a successful recruitment provider and has been supporting the healthcare market since 2003. We provide Registered Nurses, Care Assistants and Theatre Practitioners to a wide variety of private and public healthcare organisations throughout Scotland, we take pride in the service we offer not only to you, but to our clients also.  Apply for this Care Assistant job today on 0141 473 5620 to find out more about our wide range of jobs for Care Assistants we have.

About the job CLASSIFICATION: Hourly, Non-Exempt  LOCATION: Stanton, CA  JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for performing delegated clinical and administrative duties, specifically direct support to primary care providers and some direct care to patients. Responsible to work in partnership with other team members with him will be jointly accountable in achieving clinic goals.  ACCOUNTABLE TO: Clinic Lead  JOB DUTIES: Responsible to perform duties under the direction of the physician or nurse in examination and treatment of patients, including the following: Provide clinic services such as TB skin tests and administration of prescribed medication. Draw blood, gives injections, administer and read skin tests, administer immunizations and vaccinations, obtain laboratory specimens. Prepare patient for doctor examination, position instruments and equipment and assist physician. Take medical history of patients and check vital signs. Schedule appointments and keep x-ray and medical records. Responsible for inventory of laboratory supplies. Responsible for back-office logs (daily/monthly). Responsible for checking oxygen tank and crash cart supplies. Act as assistant for prescription refills. Clean and disinfect exam rooms and lab areas, autoclave instruments. Stock exam rooms; keep track of medical supplies to order when low. Participate and help implement quality improvement directives. Attend all required meetings and trainings. May be required to pick-up vaccines, medical supplies, etc. Consistently demonstrate and uphold CCCHC’s principle of providing quality health and human services to the medically underserved and low-income populations in a culturally sensitive manner. All other duties, as assigned. Special Knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Attributes Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely. Ability to plan and be organized. Ability to work well under pressure, take initiative and be flexible and cooperative. Self-motivated and independently productive. Ability to maintain confidentiality of patient information and Company records. Ability to work effectively with both employees and managers. Ability to convey a positive and professional image to patients and employees. Professional appearance and demeanor. Demonstrated proficiency in various PC applications, including E-mail, Microsoft Excel, and Word, Internet and networking devices. Required to know, follow and enforce safe work practices, and be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Required to have knowledge of CHDP guidelines, Immunizations schedule and AAP periodicity table. Must possess dependable transportation, automobile insurance, and a current CA Driver License. Required to have knowledge of OB/GYN. Education And Experience Requirements Medical Assistant Certification or Diploma required. Bilingual in English/Spanish preferred. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

About the job An opportunity has arisen to join the Clinical Coding team at The Princess Alexandra Hospital.  The Clinical Coding Department provides data to support the Trust’s clinical, activity & reflect the excellent care provided to our patients. We are looking for an enthusiastic hardworking individual to join the Clinical Coding Department as a Clinical Coding Assistant.  The Clinical Coding Department is committed to meeting the monthly targets by retrieving approx. 4,000 medical records per month following the patient’s discharge and providing these to the clinical coders for coding prior to monthly deadlines.  The Role Will Achieve This Objective By  Working closely and communicating with clinical coders, Assistant Clinical coding manager(s) & Head of Clinical Coding, medical records, ward clerks, secretaries, and clinicians. Using the tracking system and Cosmic to maximum potential to identify location of notes in a timely manner.  Highlighting to the assistant clinical coding manager (s) and/or Head of Clinical Coding any constraints that will stop the objective being achieved  The Princess Alexandra Hospital NHS Trust (PAHT) provides a full range of general acute, outpatient and diagnostic services at The Princess Alexandra Hospital in Harlow, the Herts and Essex Hospital in Bishop’s Stortford, and St Margaret’s Hospital in Epping.  We employ 3,500 staff and serve a local population of around 350,000 people living in west Essex and east Hertfordshire, centred on the M11 corridor and the towns of Harlow, Bishop’s Stortford and Epping. Our extended catchment area incorporates a population of up to 500,000 and includes the areas of Hoddesdon, Cheshunt and Broxbourne in Hertfordshire  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Matthew Taylor Job title: Assistant Clinical Coding Manager Email address: matthew.taylor32@nhs.net Telephone number: 01279978237  Or Contact  Wendy Dodman Brown, Head of Clinical Coding:  01279 978250  or by email: wendy.dodman@nhs.net

About the job  SIGN ON BONUS ELIGIBLE*** St. Luke’s Health System in Sun Valley is seeking a Credentialed Medical Assistant to join our Family Medicine Clinic team in Hailey.  Unit/Position Summary  The CMA is responsible for assisting in examination and treatment of patients under the direction of a provider and/or physician. The CMAs prepare treatment rooms for examination of patients including sterilization, cleaning, and checks on medical equipment. A CMA prepares basic laboratory tests on premises and prepares laboratory specimens, as well as entering diagnostic or medication orders under the direction of a Licensed Independent Provider (LIP).  Shift Schedule 4, 9 hour shifts per week Monday - Friday Occasional Saturday shift Responsibilities Performs various patient care activities and related nonprofessional services necessary in caring for the personal needs and comfort of patients. Documents information in patient record. Performs various direct patient care activities under direction of licensed patient care provider. Communicates information with patient care providers and other nursing staff members to facilitate patient care. Assists physicians and other nursing staff members with procedures as appropriate. Performs tasks and procedures as ordered by the physician or licensed provider consistent with approved protocols, policies, and procedures. Performs tasks that require a unique body of knowledge and skills for that area of service. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications  Education: High School Diploma or equivalent Graduation from a School of Technology for Medical Assistants Certifications Current recognized National Certification as a Medical Assistant NCCT, NAHP, AMT, AAMA, AMCA, NHA American Heart Association (AHA) BLS Provider certification Why St. Luke's  A strong, talented staff is at the heart of St. Luke’s Health System. We are the state’s largest employer with more than 15,000 employees and a medical staff of more than 1,800 physicians and advanced practice providers. We’re proud of our people who deliver skilled, compassionate care every day, and are looking to add dedicated individuals who will continue this same tradition of excellence.  For more information, please contact Jenn Sturman at sturmanje@slhs.org  Why St. Luke's

details: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Learning Support Assistant Location: Welwyn Garden City Are you an experienced and dedicated Learning Support Assistant looking for an exciting opportunity in Welwyn Garden City? Our client, a community special needs school, is seeking a passionate individual to join their team. As a Learning Support Assistant, you will play a vital role in providing individualised and holistic education and care support to up to 70 pupils aged 2-19 who have physical challenges, hearing loss, vision loss, and associated medical conditions, including life-limiting conditions in Welwyn Garden City. Responsibilities as a Learning Support Assistant: Collaborate with teachers in planning, preparing, and delivering engaging lessons and activities Provide invaluable one-to-one and small group support to pupils, ensuring their individual needs are met Offer assistance with personal care and mobility needs, promoting independence and well-being Monitor pupil progress and provide insightful feedback to teachers to aid their development Create a positive and safe learning environment, fostering growth and inclusivity for all pupilsIdeal Candidate Characteristics and Experience: Proven experience working with severe learning difficulties, profound and multiple learning difficulties, and Autism A deep passion for inspiring and assisting the development of pupils, helping them reach their full potential Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, building strong relationships with pupils, teachers, and families Demonstrated patience, empathy, and resilience in supporting pupils with diverse needs Willingness to undergo training and professional development to continuously enhance your skillsJoining this friendly and supportive school in Welwyn Garden City, you will become a valued member of a team that includes dedicated nursery nurses, teaching assistants, and apprentices. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow both personally and professionally through comprehensive on-the-job training and ongoing support in all aspects of your career development. As a Learning Support Assistant working with our agency, SENDhelp, you will also gain access to the following benefits: A dedicated consultant who will mentor you throughout your placement, providing guidance and support whenever needed Competitive pay with no commission taken from your earnings, ensuring you are fairly rewarded for your hard work Access to over 400 bespoke online and in-person training programs and courses, empowering you to expand your knowledge and expertiseIf you are passionate about making a positive impact as a Learning Support Assistant in Welwyn Garden City, don't hesitate to apply today. We eagerly await your application and look forward to welcoming you to our team of dedicated and compassionate professionals as a Learning Support Assistant

details: About the job Job Description  A fantastic opportunity for a Receptionist to join us in our well-established practice, Beaufort Dental Care. This is a fixed term contract role for 12 months, to cover maternity leave.  Part time (27 hours per week) – Monday 8 am - 7 15 pm, Thursday 8 am - 4.15 pm, Friday 8 am - 5 pm Starting August 2023, to cover maternity leave Free onsite parking  Our purpose built practice provides a wide range of private general treatment and has an excellent reputation in the local area. We have an experienced support team onsite and fully up to date digital systems and equipment.  Based just south of Burton-Upon-Trent, we are easily accessible from Birmingham, Leicester, Nottingham and Stoke.  We are a leading provider of private-focused dental care across the UK & Ireland. Recently, we have merged with Dentex bringing together two of the UK’s leading providers of private-focused dental care with shared values based on community, integrity and dedication to clinical freedom. Both companies celebrate the individuality of our practices and their teams and our shared focus remains on putting people first; this means exceptional care for our patients, industry-leading support for our practices and access to the best professional opportunities. Together we are one of the largest dental group’s in the UK, operating over 350 UK practices, with more than 4,000 members in our community, providing for more than 1.5 million patients annually across the UK, Ireland and Benelux.  If you would like to find out more about this exciting opportunity or to find out about other opportunities at Portman, please apply or alternatively, please feel free to share this opportunity with your network.  Additional Information  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, equity and inclusion in our workplace. We are committed to creating an environment of mutual respect and are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, pregnancy or maternity, marital or civil partner status, disability, age, or nationality.

details: About the job We are looking for a full time Receptionist to support the Greenfields Community Mental Health Team. Receive calls to the reception in a courteous and helpful manner, answering incoming calls and transferring callers appropriately and providing non clinical note information as required. Including maintenance of the franking machine ensuring any faults are reported to appropriate department or personnel.  Providing and receiving routine information. Our Trust is on an incredible journey of innovation and we’d like you to be part of it.  Our vision is ‘To be Outstanding in all we do and how we do it.’ Our teams pride themselves on compassion, team work and resilience. The Trust supports you by offering a flexible shift system including twilight shifts and compressed hours to support working families and our staff parking is free on all our main sites. These are:  Compassionate  Caring with compassion, it’s about how we listen, what we say, what we do.  Approachable  Friendly, welcoming, sharing ideas and being open  Responsible  Taking personal and collective responsibility, being accountable for our actions  Excellent  Striving for the best, for high-quality safe care and continually improving  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Charlotte Shevlin Job title: Team Leader Email address: charlotte.shevlin@combined.nhs.uk

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Ambulance Care Assistants roles in HAMPSHIRE Full time-37.5 hours or Bank agreement 0 hours a week. Ambulance Care Assistants pick up patients and take them to and from their appointments on time - but we are more than just drivers - we are highly trained, caring, professional people who make a positive impact on patients and colleagues every day. We offer a basic salary of £21,318. On top of this, for all hours you work between 8pm and 6am Monday Friday and any time on Saturday, you’ll get a shift bonus taking you to at least £15.41 per hour. For Sundays and Public Holidays, you could be earning at least £20.01 per hour. Averaged over the year, this means your salary could be up to £23,450. In addition to the above, we are also offering a very exciting Golden Hello to all new, substantive starters! We will pay a £500 joining incentive that is split into 2 payments. During your first week of training, you will receive £300. At the end of your second month at SCAS you will receive a final £200. If you are successful at the shortlisting stage, you will be invited to an assessment session which will look at your driving skills and your ability to lift and move patients, and to an online interview. Training is provided for the role and includes full driver training and a clinical training course that leads to an accredited qualification. It is fully paid and lasts 3 weeks. Locations: Newbury, Whiteley and Surrey. The Role: Taking patients to and from their medical appointments and treating them with dignity. Moving and lifting patients who need help. Driving a long wheel-base vehicle with manual transmission. Shift Work. You’ll work a variety of shifts from 0600-midnight, both on your own and with a colleague. Full time role is 37.5 hours a week or a Bank agreement with 0 hours. The Ambulance Care Assistant (ACA) role is a gateway into the Ambulance Service. People who join as an ACA can go on to be Team Leaders or Managers within their area or move to work in the frontline teams or one of the many supports and corporate teams

About the job Medical Laboratory Assistant - Band 3  Contract: Fixed Term -1 Year  Full-Time -37.5 hours per week  Our busy Microbiology/Pathology Department is looking for an enthusiastic and reliable person to join our team of laboratory staff, who examine specimens sent to us by the hospital doctors, local GPs and clinics.  We are a small dedicated team working within Whittington Health that delivers not just routine diagnostic support to the Hospital and local community - but has, for the past few years, provided an essential Covid-19 testing service.  Hours are 37.5 per week and participation in shift working is required.  The duties are varied and include a mixture of sample reception, laboratory work, keyboard entry of data into our computer and preparation of laboratory materials. You may be required to be available to work in other departments within Pathology in addition to Microbiology, as directed by the Laboratory managers.  Keyboard experience is essential, as are qualifications to GCSE level including English and mathematics, and you need to be of a practical nature. You must be well organised and capable of working accurately. Whilst not essential, previous laboratory experience would be an advantage. Full training will be given to the successful applicant.  Medical services have been delivered on the Whittington Hospital site for over 500 years. On 1st April 2011, Whittington Health was launched as a new Integrated Care Organisation (ICO) comprising The Whittington Hospital NHS Trust, NHS Islington and NHS Haringey. The Whittington and the community health services in Islington and Haringey are award winning organisations, delivering acute and community based health services to a population of 443,000 people.  The organisation is the biggest employer in the area, with over 4,500 staff; delivering healthcare not only on the acute hospital site which has 420 beds, but also from a variety of other community based health centres and through visits to patients homes across the boroughs to address the health needs of the local population. Whittington Health also works with other health, social care and voluntary sector partners to support patients and service users from their initial appointment whether it be with a community health team or at the hospital, all the way through to treatment and tailored after care.  We are one of the three main teaching campuses for the Royal Free and University College Medical School.  Our ICARE (Innovation, Compassion, Accountability, Respect and Excellence) Values not only help us shape what we do, but also how we do it and why. They are fundamental to the way we do business and care for our patients.  For more information, please access the following link: https://www.whittington.nhs.uk/  For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Neil Jones Job title: Laboratory Manager - Microbiology Email address: neil.jones6@nhs.net Telephone number: 0207 288 4829  Any further details required may be obtained from Neil Jones or Stephen De’Ath on 020 7288 5086. Application form is available on line at NHS jobs.

position: Home based Data Entry Admin/ Assistant
details: About the job The Home-Based Data Entry Admin/Assistant holds a central position in our organization, acting as the backbone of our data-related operations. In this role, you will be the nexus between the raw information we receive and the ordered, accessible data crucial for our everyday operations.  Your primary responsibility will be to input data promptly and precisely into our systems. A variety of data forms will come your way, ranging from textual information to complex codes, which need to be meticulously processed and entered. Your precision and keen eye for detail in handling high-volume data entry tasks is indispensable for this role.  Your responsibilities extend beyond simple data entry. As an Admin/Assistant, you will also need to ensure the accurate organization and maintenance of data records. This task involves cataloging and filing data in a systematic manner to facilitate ease of retrieval and reference.  The role also involves a significant aspect of data validation and integrity assurance. You will cross-verify data entries and correct any discrepancies or errors you identify. Your ability to spot anomalies and inconsistencies will contribute greatly to maintaining the overall data accuracy within our system.  A unique part of your role will be supporting data integration and consolidation processes. Working hand in hand with various teams, you'll help collate and unify data from different sources into cohesive and useful formats, thereby enhancing the overall efficiency of data utilization within the organization.  In addition to these responsibilities, your role includes resolving data-related issues. You will be tasked with identifying and rectifying issues that might impact data quality, working closely with your team members to ensure these problems are nipped in the bud.  Confidentiality is an essential aspect of your role as a Home-Based Data Entry Admin/Assistant. We trust you with sensitive information, and its safeguarding is expected at all times. Upholding the integrity and confidentiality of our data is a critical part of your job description.  The dynamic nature of data processing might sometimes demand you to work outside of the standard hours. Fluctuations in data volume can necessitate extended work periods to meet specific deadlines. Thus, having a flexible approach to work hours will serve you well in this role.  To thrive in this role, you need to be well organized and capable of multitasking. Additionally, you should be comfortable with working autonomously as this position necessitates a certain degree of self-direction and initiative.  Being a Home-Based Data Entry Admin/Assistant is more than just a role; it's a commitment to maintaining the efficiency and effectiveness of our data management practices. Your contributions will not only support the seamless functioning of our organization but will also help us continually elevate our standards of data handling and processing.

position: Full Time Massage Therapist for a 5 Star Hotel Spa in UK - United Kingdom .
details: About the job You must be permitted to work in this country.  Minimum experience required: over 1 year.  Salary: £22,880  Location: Newquay, GB  Essential Qualifications: NVQ - SVQ2  Start date: Open Ended  Details  The Role... This Hotel and Spa is a 5-star destination hotel and the ONLY Spa in the Southwest w...  The Role...  This Hotel and Spa is a 5-star destination hotel and the ONLY Spa in the Southwest with the Luxury 5 Bubble rating from the Good Spa Guide. Awarded Coastal Spa of the year 2021 and home to the Aqua Club, the only bespoke built swimming facility overlooking the dramatic Atlantic Coastline. The Spa has 6 treatment rooms including 2 couples treatment rooms, a beautiful relaxation room, a mosaic mud rhassoul treatment room, Hydrotherapy pool, sauna, steam room and jacuzzi with experience showers.  We are looking for therapists to join our spa team who really love what they do; full of energy and enthusiasm, they have a genuine desire to deliver the very best experience for every guest, every time. Our Spa Therapists are responsible for carrying out treatments for hotel guests, members and visitors ensuring a flawless experience is delivered every time. We pride ourselves on the guest’s journey from welcoming the guest, to delivering amazing treatments and showing our guests our wonderful Spa facilities.  Our fabulous team are important to us. Which is why we limit your massage hours. We also offer use of the facilities including the gym, the thermal journey, and the aqua club for you to relax and enjoy the beautiful spa for yourself.  We can offer full time and part time positions, giving you the work life balance to enjoy the beautiful area we are surrounded by. For those candidates who are not local already we can recommend housing and accommodation.  Ideally, this is a permanent, full-time position based on a 40-hour working week over 5 days including weekends and bank holidays.  For our Spa Therapist role, you must hold a Level 2 & 3 Beauty and Spa Therapy diploma (NVQ).  Our ideal candidate...  This position would be perfect for qualified therapists wanting to enhance and progress their experience of working in a 5* Spa. You will have a thorough knowledge of massage techniques and possess a general understanding of body and facial treatments. You will have a genuine passion for what you do and always go above and beyond for every guest, every time.  Experience working with our current product houses (OPI, Elemis, Delilah & Natural Spa Factory) would be an advantage but full training will be provided.  We are also happy to consider applications for part time or flexible working hours then on a pro rata basis. Please apply with full details on what your current availability is and how many hours you are looking to work, and we will be very happy to discuss options with you.  The rate of pay is £11.00 per hour paid monthly plus tips that are distributed each month to the whole team in addition to your wage.  Salary And Contract  This role requires flexibility as the hours that are available will include working evenings and weekends and additional hours during our busiest times. If you have what it takes to join a vibrant, multi award winning hotel, we would love to hear from you.  In line with UK Immigration and Employment Law, only applicants eligible to live and work in the UK need apply. Proof of ID will be required in the form of a Passport, National Identity Card or Birth Certificate.  Perks...  As a member of our team you can enjoy the following benefits:  Complimentary stay after 1 years service  50% off hotel stays*  50% off hotel dining*  40% off spa products  25% off spa treatments*  Gym access & weekly swim session*  Special rate for Pride of Britain Hotels*  Discounted surf lessons*  As Well As Regular Awards And Recognition  Monthly recognition awards  Annual festive awards event  Long service awards dinner Subject to availability and prior booking via manager

About the job About Us  AIRE Ancient Baths are temples dedicated to the creation of the ultimate relaxation experience, where time does not exist. Inspired by the tradition of baths from ancient Roman, Greek and Ottoman civilizations, the AIRE Experience always takes place in restored historical buildings in the center of globally acclaimed cities.  At AIRE we are proud to have an international presence with 8 established centers: NYC, Chicago, London, Copenhagen, Barcelona, Sevilla, Almeria, and Vallromanes. We are already looking into the future and moving onwards, with our soon-to-be-opened, Upper East Side and Toronto-2022- facilities.  We are even prouder of the caring, inclusive, and familiar work environment we have created for all our employees.  The role  As Massage Therapist, you will join our London team and be responsible for performing our treatments while maintaining excellent customer service and client care standards.  Key Responsibilities Perform AIRE treatments which include: massage, body treatments, scrubs, and facials. Maintain cleanliness of massage room up to company standards ensuring neatness and hygiene. Respect and follow the company's protocols. Treat our customers according to the company's guidelines. You will be delighted with our place in London, located in the Covent Garden district, where the antique house of James Matthew Barrie, the Peter’s Pan author, has been given a new lease of life and now is part of the magical AIRE atmosphere.  The team will support you from the first day and will guide you in acquiring new knowledge.  It is an exciting opportunity to join our new site in London, come and live the AIRE experience!  Who You Are You have 2 years of prior experience in a similar position. You possess a minimum qualification of NVQ Level 3 in Massage Therapy or equivalent in the UK. You have an advanced level of English. You are entirely customer-oriented and have excellent teamwork skills. You are able flexible and able to work nights, holidays, and weekends when need it. What We Offer To You Permanent contract Additional pay on weekends and holidays. Paid overtime Referral program Monthly Tips. Multiple weekend days off within the Schedule. Career progression opportunities within our Therapists team. AIRE gift experience on your birthday. AIRE will contribute to the pension scheme. Coffee at our canteen. 30% off in all our experiences. Weekend Supplement and Overtime Supplement provided.

About the job Nestled behind a secret door on the edge of our Walled Gardens, The Bothy by Wildsmith, our new space of wellbeing, has gently opened its doors.  It sits looking out over our secluded corner of Hampshire countryside, hugged by the ancient choreography of trees planted by our former Head Gardener and namesake of The Bothy’s skincare and wellbeing concept, William Walker Wildsmith.  A close connection to our surroundings and a deep respect for the natural world threads through its Wildsmith therapies – from treatments guided by the universal principles of circadian rhythm to our long awaited 18 m x 6 m chlorine-free Waters and thermal and hydrotherapies.  With the beginning of this new chapter underway, we’re looking for passionate Massage Therapists to join our team and help shape our Bothy journey.  Successful candidates will be fully committed to delivering the highest quality of guest experience, as well as professionally engaging with guests and employees to create a healing environment of warmth and joy. We’re looking to build a team that are skilled across a range of modalities to include: Biodynamic-bodywork, Shiatsu, Thai, Remedial Massage, Reflexology, Deep Tissue, Sports Massage, Lymphatic Drainage and other complementary therapies.  For your application to be considered, you must meet the following requirements:  Hold Professionally Recognised qualification (Level 3 Qualification or equivalent) Experienced with reputable industry track record Open to develop new skills and acquiring new techniques Have a caring, calm, and compassionate nature and supporting team player Represent a healthy balanced lifestyle  Benefits:  Basic salary from £24,150 PA  Service charge (estimated £4,000 to £7,000 per annum) Increased holiday allowance Vitality healthcare cover Employee assistance programme (with Hospitality Action) Life assurance scheme (from day one, covering up to 2x your annual salary) 50% F&B discount when dining in our restaurants Company sick pay Enhanced maternity pay Enhanced paternity pay Recruit a Friend bonus (£1000) Monthly employee recognition scheme Annual employee parties Free staff meals 50% discount on Wildsmith Skin products Heckfield Plus - online discounts Discount with Hunter Boots Christmas gift New baby gift  At Heckfield we pride ourselves on providing training, development and a chance to progress within the company. If you would like to work in a collaborative and creative environment, please apply now!

position: Full Time Massage Therapist for a 5 Star Hotel Spa in UK - United Kingdom .
details: About the job You must be permitted to work in this country.  Minimum experience required: over 1 year.  Salary: Negotiable based skills and experience  Location: Cornwall GB  Essential Qualifications: NVQ - SVQ3, NVQ - SVQ2  Start date: Open Ended  Details  We are looking for a top-notch Spa Therapist trained to NVQ Level 3 or above who will take pride in ...  We are looking for a top-notch Spa Therapist trained to NVQ Level 3 or above who will take pride in everything they do. In return we reward our staff with generous staff perks and amazing training opportunities.  Every member of the team at the Clearing Spa is part of the uninterrupted guest journey which is why we are so passionate about ongoing training. This position is certainly a career choice not a job offering higher than expected level of pay (£8.50 per hour) along with flexible working shifts.  With a new team at The Spa you would be joining at an exciting time when the hotel, spa and estate are all evolving.  You will receive professional training with our exclusive product house – Aromatherapy Associates. Typically gracing the pages of Tatler and treatment rooms of spas in the capital, we are one of the only spas in the South-West to feature these Artisans of Aromatherapy. This is your chance to be personally trained by these highly admired market leaders.  General Duties Include  Carrying out a full range of spa services  Maintaining high standards of cleanliness inside and outside the spa  Working as a team to enhance the guest journey  Customer Care  Our guests have high expectations, which we strive to go above and beyond every single time, working hard to achieve a seamless guest journey from the moment they step into the spa. We have longer than average turnaround times which further enhance the customer experience.  Key Attributes Needed For This Role  Immaculate presentation and standards  Professional and happy team player  Can remain calm under pressure  Ambitious and dedicated  Additional Information  Experience of working in a similar environment is essential  Knowledge of Aromatherapy Associates would be an advantage  Must be trained to NVQ Level 3 with the desire to work for more  What’s in it for you?  Staff Perks  Meals on duty  Discounted Spa gym membership (£10 per year!)  Access to staff voucher scheme redeemable at a wide range of high street retailers  Birthday & Christmas gifts  Discount on treatments, products, food and beverage  Staff and Friends/Family accommodation rates  Christmas lunch served by the management team  Reward for ‘Staff Member of the month’  Staff Referral Scheme  Added Benefits  Lifelong Learning  Ongoing Training  Career Progression and development  Commission on retail products  5-hour massage limit  Access to Childcare Voucher Scheme (if eligible)  Access employee pension scheme via NEST (if eligible)

position: Full Time Massage Therapist for a 5 Star Hotel Spa in UK - United Kingdom .
details: About the job You must be permitted to work in this country.  Minimum experience required: over 1 year.  Salary: Negotiable based skills and experience  Location: Scotland, GB  Essential Qualifications: Sports Massage Certificate  Required Skills: Maternity Massage, Sports Massage, Stone Therapy, Swedish Massage, Thai Massage  Start date: Open Ended  Details  We are a “one of a kind” business. With its unique ethos, we have changed people’s expectation...  We are a “one of a kind” business. With its unique ethos, we have changed people’s expectations of what a hotel or restaurant can be. That power has come from a team who at every level share the beliefs, passions and ambitions of its founders.  This property was the first hotel venture for us and impressively won The Times ‘Hotel of The Year’ Award in its first year of opening! This is a Victorian coaching inn situated within the village of Braemar in the magnificent Cairngorms National Park. It brings together Scottish heritage, craftsmanship and culture with world-class contemporary art and a strong sense of community.  The stunning Spa currently offers 3 treatment rooms, 2 manicure/pedicure stations, as well as a sauna overlooking the hotel garden, designed by award winning gardener Jinny Blom. The Spa works with iShga, a Scottish spa product brand.  The role...  To be the ultimate host and role model, exceeding the expectation of our guest experience in every aspect of their stay so that they leave us feeling enriched and engaged in our ethos.  What success looks like…  Guest Service  Create memorable experiences by consistently delivering exceptional spa treatments and spa experiences, ensuring that every guest feels special and wants to return.  Communication  Communicate effectively and professionally with guests and all team members, sharing knowledge and ensuring effective handover of information.  Atmosphere  Be confident and allow your personality to enhance the atmosphere by creating a warm, homely and welcoming environment to our guests.  Sales Opportunities  Positively approach sales opportunities in order to maximize revenue by making informed recommendations based on in-depth knowledge of the treatments and products, and using upselling techniques at every appropriate opportunity.  Health & Safety  Support a safe working environment by adhering to Health & Safety, Food Hygiene, Fire and Evacuation procedures and Licensing Laws.  Training  Take ownership of your personal development enhancing your ability to build knowledge and make informed recommendations.  Like all roles, you can expect your time at work to be fun, varied and challenging. As well as fulfilling the duties and responsibilities on your job description, we know from experience that jobs can evolve throughout the lifetime of a role and this in turn gives our people the chance to play to their strengths.  What makes a brilliant Spa Therapist?  Proven experience required. Excellent communication skills and an ability to work under pressure. Must have a strong work ethic along with a passion and flair for brilliant customer service. Desire to learn and grow.  You also have the right to work in the UK.  Be yourself! That’s who we’re hiring. Our culture celebrates and supports the differences that make each of us unique.  We’ve got some core values that run through everything that we do, we’d love it if these values resonate with you too! Sustainability is at the heart of our business and every one of the team has a role to play in protecting our planet.  What’s in it for you?  Competitive pay plus Tronc  30 days holiday  Health benefit: health cash plan  Employee Assistance Programme  Local discounts and incentives  Savings at thousands of retailers via our online discounts portal  Optional pension plan  Life Assurance  02 phone discount  Free food and drinks whilst on shift  Training and development opportunities  Want to join the family? Apply today!

About the job EF Academy Oxford is seeking an experienced Computer Science teacher to join our faculty. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering high-quality, engaging lessons that inspire and motivate our students. This is a part-time role, reporting to the Head of Mathematics and starting on the 29th August. As an international boarding school for students aged 16-19, we hold our students to rigorous academic standards and seek a teacher who can support us in achieving these expectations while fostering a genuine passion for computer science.  Key Responsibilities Will Include  Plan and deliver high-quality lessons in accordance with the OCR Computer Science syllabus Ensure that all lessons are well-planned in accordance with EF Academy Oxford’s academic policy and that unit plans are saved on the Academy network and available for monitoring in the classroom Provide effective intervention to help students who are struggling with the course material Monitor and evaluate the quality of teaching and learning, and adjust as necessary to improve student attainment Ensure that all students receive high-quality formative feedback and that this is evident in marking Implement subject-based intervention plans for underachieving students Ensure that subject reports provide appropriate information regarding strengths, weaknesses, and strategies for improvement Promote intellectual and cultural enrichment activities for students, both in and out of the classroom.  In addition to the core teaching responsibilities, part-time employees at EF Academy Oxford are expected to support the Academic Tutor role, providing guidance and support to a group of students on a pro-rata basis. Part-time teachers are also required to support an after-school club or activity, as well as offer additional support sessions for students seeking clarification in proportion to their working hours. Moreover, occasional involvement in evening and weekend excursions, as well as student life activities, is considered an integral part of the role for part-time employees, contributing to a well-rounded educational experience for our students while aligning with their reduced working hours.  Essential  Person Specification:  A degree in Computer Science or a related field. A recognised teaching qualification. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, to effectively engage with students. Strong organisational skills to manage part-time teaching responsibilities efficiently. Ability to work effectively as part of a team, collaborating with other faculty members. Capability to deliver high-quality lessons that engage and inspire students, promoting their progress towards individual, Faculty, and Academy targets while considering the reduced teaching hours. A passion for teaching and a genuine interest in the subject area of Computer Science. Enthusiastic, energetic, and creative in delivering lessons with limited time. Patient and empathetic towards students, accommodating their learning needs within the part-time schedule. A commitment to maintaining high standards of professionalism and ethical conduct, fostering a positive and inclusive learning environment.  Desirable  Experience of teaching A Level Computer Science or a similar curriculum. Experience of promoting academic, intellectual, and cultural enrichment activities related to Computer Science for students. A commitment to continuing professional development, keeping up with the latest advancements in the field. Experience of working in an educational environment, understanding the unique needs of students at the A Level stage.  This is a part-time role with a competitive salary, stakeholder pension and lunch during working hours included. In addition, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to participate in workshops and other professional development opportunities, as well as the chance to work in a small and supportive school community.  At EF Academy Oxford, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse community that celebrates and values differences. We welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds and identities, and we encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply. As an equal opportunity employer, we aim to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination, harassment, and bias, and that promotes equality and diversity in all aspects of school life.  Applicants must be able to provide evidence of having the right to live and work in the UK. EF Academy is committed to a safeguarding culture in which its students can thrive. All candidates must undergo an enhanced DBS check and further safer recruitment checks as appropriate to ensure their suitability to work in a school environment. All staff are expected to promote and safeguard the welfare of students and must adhere to the School's Safeguarding Policy and Code of Conduct. EF Academy Oxford is an equal opportunities employer. Further details are available from Claudia Cedraro (Claudia.C@ef.com).  About EF Education First  At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.  When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, caste, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.  Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://www.ef.com.
