details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a CT Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: CT Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, days Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 3/27/2023 4/3/2023 4/10/2023 4/17/2023 TR ID 118917 Salary:$69,140.00 Job Summary This position is responsible for working directly with patients and assisting radiologists and/or staff physicians while administering ionizing radiation in the course of computerized tomography (CT) examinations in concordance with physician s orders. This professionally trained person will be responsible for the operation of CT scanners, flow rate injectors, an EKG monitoring system, a picture archiving system. This position is responsible for the use of radiographic supplies including iodinated contrast while providing patient care and patient safety as established by department standards. This position is responsible for performing a variety of basic secretarial, clerical and housekeeping functions such as customer service, examination and work area cleaning, telephone communications, computer system data entry, information retrieval, (HIS, RIS, PACS), and infection control. This position, in addition to superb technical skills, will also require the ability to follow the CRMC service commitments to customers and fellow staff. Other duties as assigned. Position assures compliance and upholding of the Medical Center s policy of non-discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, physical or mental handicap, pregnancy or veteran status. Position may interact with all ages of patients, guests, staff and others. Education Associates Required Additional Education Requirements Certification, CT Required, And BLS Healthcare Provider Required Additional Certification Details Certified by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (ARRT) as a CT Technologist preferred. If not currently registered in CT, must obtain CT certification within one year of completing CT training. Experience Two years experience with all types of CT exams on multi-slice scanner is preferred. Operates Computerized Tomography scanners, flow regulated injectors, UPS systems, patient monitors, hospital computer systems and other associated medical imaging equipment. Have the ability to deal with patients, families and other hospital employees in a professional and caring manner in times of great stress and crises. Have the abilty tohandle constant pressure, stress and numerous interruptions associated with the busy schedule in the CT area. Job Requirements: Maintains Current Licensure/Certifications Attends Mandatory Meetings Attends at least 50% of unit meetings Reads 100% of meeting minutes not attended within 30 days Reads emails in a timely manner Completes Health Stream assignments on time Completes unit specific competencies in a timely manner Education Remains current on latest techniques and methods relative to CT exams. Demonstrates a willingness to learn new procedures and willingly accepts new responsibility. Performs other related duties as may be assigned or requested within the scope of education, skillsand/or experience Gives a copy of all continuing education, current ARRT and BLS cards to Chief CT Technologist. Knowledge of Job Continually keeps up to date with changes in protocols, procedures and scanning techniques. Demonstrates knowledge of day-to-day operations and organization of the CT area. Has knowledge of normal anatomy and basic pathology. Knows how and when to deviate protocols to best demonstrate unusual findings. Consistently demonstrates proper knowledge to safely adjust the complex physics of the CT scanners including; pitch, rotation time, table feed, filters/kernels and dose modulation. Understands and uses injector procedures and protocols in the safest manner. Always labels and accesses contrast according to proper technique. Is not wasteful and shares cost savings ideas. Patient care Always greets the patient by introducing self and calls patient by name. Verifies the appropriate patient by asking the patient their name, date of birth, and checking their armband. Completes patient procedure form and explains post procedure care to the patient. Explains the procedure to the patient and allows the patient time to ask questions. Always carefully observes patients during procedures listening for complaints and watching for unusual occurrences. Documents any problems that occur during the examination. Always notifies the Radiologist when patients are waiting for results. Communicates any problems with the procedures with the ordering physician and/or office staff. Ensures patients are reconnected to IV fluids, oxygen, and monitors prior to leaving the department, when applicable. Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n272643.

position: Permanent Allied Health Professional - Radiology Technologist
details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a Radiology Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: Radiology Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, flexible Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 3/27/2023 4/3/2023 4/10/2023 4/17/2023 TR ID 118920 Salary: $61,360.00 We have 5 open Full-Time Radiologic Technologist positions (shifts below). The pay range is $19.14-$29.50/hr., depending on experience as to where they fall at within the pay range. Saturday/Sunday 7a-9:30p, Monday 7p-7a (39 hours/week) Monday-Friday 1:30p-9:30p Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday 7p-6a, Friday 9:30p-6a (39 hours/week) Week 1: Monday-Thursday 8:30p-7a, Week 2: Friday-Sunday 5:30p-6a Week 1: Monday-Thursday 8:30p-7a, Week 2: Friday-Sunday 5:30p-6a We also offer a sign on bonus or loan forgiveness with a 2 year contract post orientation (with terms): 2+ years experience- $7,500 sign on bonus OR- up to $3,500 loan forgiveness with a 2 year contract post orientation Job Summary This position is responsible for working directly with patients and assisting radiologists and/or staff physicians while administering x-rays in the course of radiological examinations in concordance with physician orders. The radiologic technologist shall be capable of operating radiologic equipment, perform a variety of radiological procedures, operate the picture archiving system, use radiographic supplies including contrast while providing patient care and patient safety as established by department standards. This position is responsible for performing a variety of basic clerical and housekeeping functions such as examination and work area cleaning, telephone communications, computer system data entry, information retrieval (HIS, RIS, PACS), and infection control. The level I technologist shall be competent in the following areas: general radiography, routine fluoroscopy including barium studies, portable and emergent trauma radiography, radiographic technique formulation, radiographic quality control and basic surgical radiographic procedures. Level I technologists exercise professional judgment while performing services in a demeanor complimentary to customer service, age specific criteria, safety and medical ethics. Other duties as assigned. Position assures compliance and upholding of the Medical Center s policy of non-discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, physical or mental handicap, pregnancy or veteran status. Position may interact with all ages of patients, guests, staff and others. Education Associates Required Additional Education Requirements Graduate of an AMA approved School of Radiologic Technology. AAS or BS in Radiologic Sciences preferred. Radiological Technologist Required, And BLS Healthcare Provider Required Registered with the ARRT The candidate must successfully pass the national registry test for radiologic technology within 12 months from the start of being registry eligible. Experience Two years of Clinical experience in an ARRT accredited radiologic technology program. Additional on the job experience is preferred. Job Requirements: Maintains Current Licensure/Certifications Attends Mandatory Meetings Attends at least 50% of unit meetings Reads 100% of meeting minutes not attended within 30 days Reads emails in a timely manner Completes Health Stream assignments on time Completes unit specific competencies in a timely manner Technical/Job Skills Standards: Competently operates and understands basic operational features of radiographic equipment. Strives to assure all pertinent anatomy included on all radiographs and that proper positioning is obtained. Demonstrates knowledge of technical factor selection and manipulation for optimal radiograph exposure with minimal patient dose. Demonstrates knowledge of, and routinely performs, proper critique of radiographs to include, but not limited to; proper anatomical positioning, all pertinent anatomy included, proper technique, proper patient demographics, proper use of personalized position markers with evidence of collimation on views where applicable. Demonstrates knowledge of proper image processing ensuring successful transmission to PACS system. Sufficient knowledge of how to manage the PACS system to ensure correct patient/exam information is in the system. Demonstrates knowledge of use, and routinely utilizes, positioning aids, to obtain correct positioning of patient and to eliminate need for repeats due to motion, etc. Strives to maintain reject rate below department standard without sacrificing film quality on exams turned in for dictation. Asks for guidance from senior technologist if additional views would be beneficial. Assures all pertinent forms and documents are completed and sent to Medical Records (pregnancy forms, contrast criteria sheets, consent forms, etc). Demonstrates knowledge required for assisting and working with radiologists. Assures all supplies and exam room ready before calling for a radiologist. Ensures all images are in PACS correctly. Able to obtain vital signs and record as needed for procedures. Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n272649.  Benefits  Sign-On bonus

position: Permanent Allied Health Professional - CT Technologist
details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a CT Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: CT Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, nights Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 04/24/2023 5/8/2023 5/22/2023 6/5/2023 TR ID 107886 CT Technologist (Full-Time / Nights) Shift; 7p-730a Salary:$77,000.00 float applicable if requested by scheduling CT Technologist- Performs a variety of technical and patient care procedures that require independent judgment utilizing a multi-slice CT scanner. Utilizes power injectors and monitoring equipment. Starts IVs and administers IV, oral, or rectal contrast at the direction of the physician onsite. Provides exemplary customer service. Participates and is engaged in a team framework and maintains a positive approach and attitude. Continues to use their radiology technology experience doing diagnostic X-ray and Fluoroscopy work. Demonstrates complete understanding of multi-slice CT scan applications. Accurately provides diagnostic images and related functions. Demonstrates working knowledge of human anatomy to satisfactorily allow optimum positioning of patients for imaging procedure. Performs procedure in a manner which allows patients to be comfortable, both physically and emotionally. Demonstrates knowledge and application of radiation safety, use of protective devices and application of universal precaution techniques. Maintains up-to-date knowledge and information of current scan techniques. Enters exam data entry/charges in a manner consistent with department policy. Performs transporting of patients, file and/or reception duties as necessary. Maintains availability for on-call status per policy. Demonstrates ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities in an efficient manner. Demonstrates a good understanding of departmental operations and patient flow. Accurately prepares, dispenses, and administers (by injection, orally or rectally) all x-ray contrast in use in CT. Consistently follows departmental protocols and procedures. Obtains and documents relevant patient history to determine appropriateness of CT exam and communicates information to the radiologist. Demonstrates patient care skills appropriate for all age groups, neonate through geriatric and utilizes age specific imaging protocols. Consistently able to receive directions from the radiologist and apply good judgment. Is cooperative, respectful and helpful to all others in the workplace (co-workers, managers, and physicians) in support of the delivery of patient care and services. Conducts appropriate discussions regarding operational, system and personnel issues with the Lead Technologist or Medical Director. Demonstrates initiative to learn new or evolving procedures and practices in the CT department. Participates in promotion of services as necessary. Accepts instruction, guidance and corrections in a positive manner. Performs duties and functions appropriate to, and confines interactions (either verbal or written) with patients or other health care professionals, within the scope of practice of a CT technologist. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. This includes various types of x-ray equipment and applications, to include c-arm, portable, RF, etc. Proficiency with fluoroscopic procedures. Qualifications: Required qualifications for this position include: Successful completion of a program in Radiologic Technology as accepted by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists Current Washington State certification as a Radiologic Technologist Diagnostic license Basic Life Support (BLS) certification 1 year experience as a Radiologic Technologist Ability to take x-rays as needed. Required within 1 year of hire National Registered Technologist - Computed Tomography Or Required within 1 year of hire National Computed Tomography Technologist - Nuclear Medicine Technology Certification Board Preferred qualifications for this position include: CT experience Board registered by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) required, with Advanced Certification in Computed Tomography Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n266120.

About the job About The Role  We have a new opportunity for a PET-CT Radiographer/Technologist to join the team at our Turner Diagnostic Centre - Colchester.  You will ideally have a background in nuclear medicine and be experienced in handling and dispensing radiopharmaceuticals, although this would be a great opportunity for a Radiographer to develop in this modality.  Some experience in CT is also desirable but not essential for this role.  You will undertake a competency programme in PET-CT to develop your knowledge and help you gain a full understanding of PET-CT. Training will be delivered “On the Job” and in collaboration with the Christie School of Oncology via the PET-CT training academy. You will also be required to IV cannulate patients as part of the role. Rest assured, should you not have any prior experience in IV cannulation, Alliance Medical will provide full training.  Please note that we will be interviewing throughout the duration of this advert. Therefore if you are interested in this role an early application is advised as we may close the advert prior to the advertised date  About Alliance Medical  Alliance Medical are Europe’s leading independent provider of imaging services.  We combine service excellence and innovative imaging technologies to improve patient care and support NHS and independent organisations with their ongoing imaging requirements. Our approach has delivered consistent company growth for more than 30 years.  We live by our company values to ensure the highest level of patient care:  Our Values  Leaders, managers, and supervisors have a particular responsibility to be role models in terms of how they demonstrate these values themselves and how they engage their teams to work in this way.  Collaboration  We work together and in partnership for all our patients. We respect expertise and combine it to achieve more.  Excellence  We never compromise. We strive to deliver the very best in everything we do to ensure the highest quality of care. We treat our patients and each other with compassion, dignity and respect.  Learning  Knowledge and understanding comes from learning. At Alliance Medical we are committed to ensuring that each and every one of us keeps on learning and that we continuously look for improved ways of working.  Efficiency  Efficiency in healthcare means more patients get better care. We constantly seek new ways to use the scarce resource of healthcare more intelligently so that more people can live longer, fuller lives.  Openness  We act with transparency and honesty in everything we do, where staff are encouraged to speak up to ensure a safe and secure environment for our patients.  Skills And Experience  The successful candidate must have:  BSc/DCR in Diagnostic Radiography and/or Diploma in Nuclear Medicine or equivalent Awareness of, and compliance with Alliance Medical Policies and Procedures, Radiation Regulations (IRMER, IRR 99 and EPR 2010) if modality requires this, CQC requirements and Health and Safety legislation Awareness of, and compliance with Data Protection and Patient confidentiality  And to be prepared to Undertake initial and refresher mandatory training to ensure compliance at all times.  While Being Able To Demonstrate  Experience and knowledge in area of expertise desired but not essential Experienced in PET-CT an advantage IV Cannulation Certificate preferred-training will be provided Must be IT literate Enhanced DBS clearance required Flexibility to operate across multiple sites if required CT experienced desirable Patient care experience/skills Excellent interpersonal and organisation skills including time management Excellent communication and negotiating skills High energy level – able to collaborate across teams to achieve a common goal Ability to motivate self and other members of your team and appropriately delegate Positive approach to change Flexible approach to working hours

About the job About The Role  We have a new opportunity for a PET-CT Radiographer/Technologist to join the team at our Guildford PET-CT Centre.  You will ideally have a background in nuclear medicine and be experienced in handling and dispensing radiopharmaceuticals, although this would be a great opportunity for a Radiographer to develop in this modality.  Some experience in CT is also desirable but not essential for this role.  You will undertake a competency programme in PET-CT to develop your knowledge and help you gain a full understanding of PET-CT. Training will be delivered “On the Job” and in collaboration with the Christie School of Oncology via the PET-CT training academy. You will also be required to IV cannulate patients as part of the role. Rest assured, should you not have any prior experience in IV cannulation, Alliance Medical will provide full training.  Please note that we will be interviewing throughout the duration of this advert. Therefore if you are interested in this role an early application is advised as we may close the advert prior to the advertised date  Skills And Experience  Experience and knowledge in area of expertise desired but not essential Awareness of, and compliance with Alliance Medical Policies and Procedures, Radiation Regulations (IRMER, IRR 99 and EPR 2010) if modality requires this, CQC requirements and Health and Safety legislation Awareness of, and compliance with Data Protection and Patient confidentiality Undertake initial and refresher mandatory training to ensure compliance at all times  Skills  Patient care experience/skills Excellent interpersonal and organisation skills including time management Excellent communication and negotiating skills High energy level – able to collaborate across teams to achieve a common goal Ability to motivate self and other members of your team and appropriately delegate Positive approach to change Flexible approach to working hours  Experience  BSc/DCR in Diagnostic Radiography and/or Diploma in Nuclear Medicine Experienced in PET-CT an advantage IV Cannulation Certificate preferred Must be IT literate Enhanced DBS clearance required Flexibility to operate across multiple sites if required CT experienced desirable Our Values  Alliance Medical are Europe’s leading independent provider of imaging services.  We combine service excellence and innovative imaging technologies to improve patient care and support NHS and independent organisations with their ongoing imaging requirements. Our approach has delivered consistent company growth for more than 30 years.  We operate a robust pre-employment screening process for all roles which includes proof of professional registration and qualifications, DBS checking and occupational health assessments.  We live by our company values to ensure the highest level of patient care:  Our Values  Leaders, managers, and supervisors have a particular responsibility to be role models in terms of how they demonstrate these values themselves and how they engage their teams to work in this way.  Collaboration  We work together and in partnership for all our patients. We respect expertise and combine it to achieve more.  Excellence  We never compromise. We strive to deliver the very best in everything we do to ensure the highest quality of care. We treat our patients and each other with compassion, dignity and respect.  Learning  Knowledge and understanding comes from learning. At Alliance Medical we are committed to ensuring that each and every one of us keeps on learning and that we continuously look for improved ways of working.  Efficiency  Efficiency in healthcare means more patients get better care. We constantly seek new ways to use the scarce resource of healthcare more intelligently so that more people can live longer, fuller lives.  Openness  We act with transparency and honesty in everything we do, where staff are encouraged to speak up to ensure a safe and secure environment for our patients.

position: Rad Tech - Urgent Care; Southampton; Weekends
details: About the job Cooley Dickinson is the hospital where Radiologic Technologists can grow and accelerate their careers. We are seeking professionals who are committed to the highest quality patient care and will contribute to our on-going pursuit of excellence.  About Us  With energy and purpose, Cooley Dickinson Health Care, a member of the Mass General Brigham system, is advancing health care in western Massachusetts, and has been since 1886. Our network employs more than 2,000 medical professionals and support staff, at our main Hospital campus in Northampton and additional locations in twelve towns throughout the Pioneer Valley. Cooley Dickinson’s VNA & Hospice is also a vital part of our network, providing home-based services throughout Hampshire and Franklin counties.  Accolades and Recognition  Some Of These Awards Include  Our staff has been consistently recognized for the quality of care and commitment to patient safety provided on a daily basis.  Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)  5-star rating The American Association of Critical Care Nurses (AACN) Beacon Award for Excellence Human Rights Campaign Foundation LGBTQ+ Healthcare Equality Leader designation The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) awarded a Level 3 Geriatric Emergency Department Accreditation (GEDA) Baby-Friendly USA designated Baby-Friendly Hospital Newsweek Magazine and Statista named us one of the country’s Best Maternity Hospitals Cooley Dickinson has earned six consecutive ‘A’ Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade and the Top General Hospital award  Our Benefits  In addition to competitive pay, all Cooley Dickinson employees who work 20 hours or more per week have access to the following benefits with no waiting period:  a range of health, dental, vision, prescription and life insurance benefits  a generous and flexible Earned Time Off program starting at six weeks accrual per year  403(b) retirement plan with various investment options  opportunities and support for continued education including tuition reimbursement  The Radiologic Technologist is responsible for performing radiographic procedures using stationary, portable, and specialized equipment at a technical and professional level that does not require constant supervision and is of acceptable quality.  This position reports to the Supervisor, Diagnostic Radiology and operates within established organizational and departmental policies and procedures.  Minimum Requirements  Associate’s degree required. For those candidates who meet requirements of licensing and registration agencies and have been grandfathered by those agencies, Associate’s degree requirement may be waived, but a high school diploma or equivalent is required Current licensure by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and registry eligibility required; ARRT registration must be completed within six (6) months of hire. Continuing education credits must meet State and Registry Licensing requirements Current CPR certification required 1 year of experience preferred; technologists must be trained and capable of handling patients completely from invitro through adult  Primary Location  MA-Southampton-CDH Southampton Satellite  Work Locations  CDH Southampton Satellite  Job  X-Ray  Organization  Cooley Dickinson Hospital (CDH)  Schedule  Part-time  Standard Hours  8  Shift  Day Job  Posted Shift Description  8 hours per week every other weekend  Employee Status  Regular  Recruiting Department  CDH Urgent Care  Job Posting  Jun 5, 2023

About the job CTS Technologist - Industrial Team  We have an opportunity for someone to become part of the CTS Industrial team. The role will be providing support to customers via technical guidance and deliver solutions to meet the customers' needs and applications.  Developing a collaborative relationship with CTS, R&D, OEM, Sales, and Marketing to share and gain an understanding of current and future market trends, requirements and applications that will impact our product portfolio.  Bringing customers’ feedback in current technology to develop the future technology roadmap and be voice of customer in associated NPDs.  Be a key player within the Account Management Triangle (Sales, Marketing, CTS), and contributing to Customer Portfolio Analysis, enabling the team to great discovery to ensure recommendation and delivery of innovative solutions.  Develop insightful technical literature to support product portfolio for both internal and external customers.  Increase customer loyalty by proactively investigating and resolving customer concerns.  Develop understanding of Afton’s product line chemistry, OEM claims and applications.  Initiate development of a deep understanding of industry test requirements, customer test requirements and associated specifications and how those tests can be influenced by Afton chemistry.  Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering  Demonstrated aptitude for the CTS function.  Skills/ Abilities  Decision Making - Timely decision making using a mixture of analysis, experience, and judgment; sometimes with incomplete information, under tight deadlines with appropriate risk, authority and transparency Business Insight - Has knowledge of general business model, practices and procedures. Understands how the actions and output of the role impacts the business and others. Analysis and Problem Solving - Solves problems with effective solutions by asking good questions, involving others, and looking outside of existing processes and procedures. Has technical knowledge and skills to troubleshoot test equipment or test precision issues. Communication – Can communicate information clearly, effectively, and timely in an engaging and convincing manner. Managing Performance - Possessing the drive and focus to achieve challenging individual and team goals. Collaboration and Networking - The ability to work within and across Afton's organizational matrix to achieve objectives, including the capability to influence without authority. Project Management - The ability to manage tasks and activities and achieve their completion within the agreed framework, across regional and organizational boundaries as appropriate Innovation - Continuously assesses current processes, practices, procedures, techniques and tools and provides suggestions for improvement. Open to new concepts. May benchmark outside laboratories or others for process improvement ideas. Dealing with Uncertainty - Is sufficiently flexible to effectively cope with change, multiple priorities, and lack of information at times Customer Relationship Management – Interpersonal skills to be able to make good strong connections with customers & OEM personnel. Combination of character & technical credibility. Demonstrate customer intimacy and Passion for Solutions approach to understand core technical problems and deliver solutions to business, marketing and external customers.

Has knowledge of normal anatomy and basic pathology. Knows how and when to deviate protocols to best demonstrate unusual findings. Consistently demonstrates proper knowledge to safely adjust the complex physics of the CT scanners including; pitch, rotation time, table feed, filters/kernels and dose modulation. Understands and uses injector procedures and protocols in the safest manner. Always labels and accesses contrast according to proper technique. Is not wasteful and shares cost savings ideas. Patient care Always greets the patient by introducing self and calls patient by name. Verifies the appropriate patient by asking the patient their name, date of birth, and checking their armband. Completes patient procedure form and explains post procedure care to the patient. Explains the procedure to the patient and allows the patient time to ask questions. details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a Radiology Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: Radiology Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, flexible Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 3/27/2023 4/3/2023 4/10/2023 4/17/2023 TR ID 118920 Salary: $61,360.00 We have 5 open Full-Time Radiologic Technologist positions (shifts below). The pay range is $19.14-$29.50/hr., depending on experience as to where they fall at within the pay range. Saturday/Sunday 7a-9:30p, Monday 7p-7a (39 hours/week) Monday-Friday 1:30p-9:30p Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday 7p-6a, Friday 9:30p-6a (39 hours/week) Week 1: Monday-Thursday 8:30p-7a, Week 2: Friday-Sunday 5:30p-6a Week 1: Monday-Thursday 8:30p-7a, Week 2: Friday-Sunday 5:30p-6a We also offer a sign on bonus or loan forgiveness with a 2 year contract post orientation (with terms): 2+ years experience- $7,500 sign on bonus OR- up to $3,500 loan forgiveness with a 2 year contract post orientation Job Summary This position is responsible for working directly with patients and assisting radiologists and/or staff physicians while administering x-rays in the course of radiological examinations in concordance with physician orders. The radiologic technologist shall be capable of operating radiologic equipment, perform a variety of radiological procedures, operate the picture archiving system, use radiographic supplies including contrast while providing patient care and patient safety as established by department standards. This position is responsible for performing a variety of basic clerical and housekeeping functions such as examination and work area cleaning, telephone communications, computer system data entry, information retrieval (HIS, RIS, PACS), and infection control. The level I technologist shall be competent in the following areas: general radiography, routine fluoroscopy including barium studies, portable and emergent trauma radiography, radiographic technique formulation, radiographic quality control and basic surgical radiographic procedures. Level I technologists exercise professional judgment while performing services in a demeanor complimentary to customer service, age specific criteria, safety and medical ethics. Other duties as assigned. Position assures compliance and upholding of the Medical Center s policy of non-discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, physical or mental handicap, pregnancy or veteran status. Position may interact with all ages of patients, guests, staff and others. Education Associates Required Additional Education Requirements Graduate of an AMA approved School of Radiologic Technology. AAS or BS in Radiologic Sciences preferred. Radiological Technologist Required, And BLS Healthcare Provider Required Registered with the ARRT The candidate must successfully pass the national registry test for radiologic technology within 12 months from the start of being registry eligible. Experience Two years of Clinical experience in an ARRT accredited radiologic technology program. Additional on the job experience is preferred. Job Requirements: Maintains Current Licensure/Certifications Attends Mandatory Meetings Attends at least 50% of unit meetings Reads 100% of meeting minutes not attended within 30 days Reads emails in a timely manner Completes Health Stream assignments on time Completes unit specific competencies in a timely manner Technical/Job Skills Standards: Competently operates and understands basic operational features of radiographic equipment. Strives to assure all pertinent anatomy included on all radiographs and that proper positioning is obtained. Demonstrates knowledge of technical factor selection and manipulation for optimal radiograph exposure with minimal patient dose. Demonstrates knowledge of, and routinely performs, proper critique of radiographs to include, but not limited to; proper anatomical positioning, all pertinent anatomy included, proper technique, proper patient demographics, proper use of personalized position markers with evidence of collimation on views where applicable. Demonstrates knowledge of proper image processing ensuring successful transmission to PACS system. Sufficient knowledge of how to manage the PACS system to ensure correct patient/exam information is in the system. Demonstrates knowledge of use, and routinely utilizes, positioning aids, to obtain correct positioning of patient and to eliminate need for repeats due to motion, etc. Strives to maintain reject rate below department standard without sacrificing film quality on exams turned in for dictation. Asks for guidance from senior technologist if additional views would be beneficial. Assures all pertinent forms and documents are completed and sent to Medical Records (pregnancy forms, contrast criteria sheets, consent forms, etc). Demonstrates knowledge required for assisting and working with radiologists. Assures all supplies and exam room ready before calling for a radiologist. Ensures all images are in PACS correctly. Able to obtain vital signs and record as needed for procedures. Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n272649.  Benefits  Sign-On bonus

position: Permanent Allied Health Professional - CT Technologist
details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a CT Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: CT Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, nights Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 04/24/2023 5/8/2023 5/22/2023 6/5/2023 TR ID 107886 CT Technologist (Full-Time / Nights) Shift; 7p-730a Salary:$77,000.00 float applicable if requested by scheduling CT Technologist- Performs a variety of technical and patient care procedures that require independent judgment utilizing a multi-slice CT scanner. Utilizes power injectors and monitoring equipment. Starts IVs and administers IV, oral, or rectal contrast at the direction of the physician onsite. Provides exemplary customer service. Participates and is engaged in a team framework and maintains a positive approach and attitude. Continues to use their radiology technology experience doing diagnostic X-ray and Fluoroscopy work. Demonstrates complete understanding of multi-slice CT scan applications. Accurately provides diagnostic images and related functions. Demonstrates working knowledge of human anatomy to satisfactorily allow optimum positioning of patients for imaging procedure. Performs procedure in a manner which allows patients to be comfortable, both physically and emotionally. Demonstrates knowledge and application of radiation safety, use of protective devices and application of universal precaution techniques. Maintains up-to-date knowledge and information of current scan techniques. Enters exam data entry/charges in a manner consistent with department policy. Performs transporting of patients, file and/or reception duties as necessary. Maintains availability for on-call status per policy. Demonstrates ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities in an efficient manner. Demonstrates a good understanding of departmental operations and patient flow. Accurately prepares, dispenses, and administers (by injection, orally or rectally) all x-ray contrast in use in CT. Consistently follows departmental protocols and procedures. Obtains and documents relevant patient history to determine appropriateness of CT exam and communicates information to the radiologist. Demonstrates patient care skills appropriate for all age groups, neonate through geriatric and utilizes age specific imaging protocols. Consistently able to receive directions from the radiologist and apply good judgment. Is cooperative, respectful and helpful to all others in the workplace (co-workers, managers, and physicians) in support of the delivery of patient care and services. Conducts appropriate discussions regarding operational, system and personnel issues with the Lead Technologist or Medical Director. Demonstrates initiative to learn new or evolving procedures and practices in the CT department. Participates in promotion of services as necessary. Accepts instruction, guidance and corrections in a positive manner. Performs duties and functions appropriate to, and confines interactions (either verbal or written) with patients or other health care professionals, within the scope of practice of a CT technologist. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. This includes various types of x-ray equipment and applications, to include c-arm, portable, RF, etc. Proficiency with fluoroscopic procedures. Qualifications: Required qualifications for this position include: Successful completion of a program in Radiologic Technology as accepted by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists Current Washington State certification as a Radiologic Technologist Diagnostic license Basic Life Support (BLS) certification 1 year experience as a Radiologic Technologist Ability to take x-rays as needed. Required within 1 year of hire National Registered Technologist - Computed Tomography Or Required within 1 year of hire National Computed Tomography Technologist - Nuclear Medicine Technology Certification Board Preferred qualifications for this position include: CT experience Board registered by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) required, with Advanced Certification in Computed Tomography Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n266120.

About the job About The Role  We have a new opportunity for a PET-CT Radiographer/Technologist to join the team at our Turner Diagnostic Centre - Colchester.  You will ideally have a background in nuclear medicine and be experienced in handling and dispensing radiopharmaceuticals, although this would be a great opportunity for a Radiographer to develop in this modality.  Some experience in CT is also desirable but not essential for this role.  You will undertake a competency programme in PET-CT to develop your knowledge and help you gain a full understanding of PET-CT. Training will be delivered “On the Job” and in collaboration with the Christie School of Oncology via the PET-CT training academy. You will also be required to IV cannulate patients as part of the role. Rest assured, should you not have any prior experience in IV cannulation, Alliance Medical will provide full training.  Please note that we will be interviewing throughout the duration of this advert. Therefore if you are interested in this role an early application is advised as we may close the advert prior to the advertised date  About Alliance Medical  Alliance Medical are Europe’s leading independent provider of imaging services.  We combine service excellence and innovative imaging technologies to improve patient care and support NHS and independent organisations with their ongoing imaging requirements. Our approach has delivered consistent company growth for more than 30 years.  We live by our company values to ensure the highest level of patient care:  Our Values  Leaders, managers, and supervisors have a particular responsibility to be role models in terms of how they demonstrate these values themselves and how they engage their teams to work in this way.  Collaboration  We work together and in partnership for all our patients. We respect expertise and combine it to achieve more.  Excellence  We never compromise. We strive to deliver the very best in everything we do to ensure the highest quality of care. We treat our patients and each other with compassion, dignity and respect.  Learning  Knowledge and understanding comes from learning. At Alliance Medical we are committed to ensuring that each and every one of us keeps on learning and that we continuously look for improved ways of working.  Efficiency  Efficiency in healthcare means more patients get better care. We constantly seek new ways to use the scarce resource of healthcare more intelligently so that more people can live longer, fuller lives.  Openness  We act with transparency and honesty in everything we do, where staff are encouraged to speak up to ensure a safe and secure environment for our patients.  Skills And Experience  The successful candidate must have:  BSc/DCR in Diagnostic Radiography and/or Diploma in Nuclear Medicine or equivalent Awareness of, and compliance with Alliance Medical Policies and Procedures, Radiation Regulations (IRMER, IRR 99 and EPR 2010) if modality requires this, CQC requirements and Health and Safety legislation Awareness of, and compliance with Data Protection and Patient confidentiality  And to be prepared to Undertake initial and refresher mandatory training to ensure compliance at all times.  While Being Able To Demonstrate  Experience and knowledge in area of expertise desired but not essential Experienced in PET-CT an advantage IV Cannulation Certificate preferred-training will be provided Must be IT literate Enhanced DBS clearance required Flexibility to operate across multiple sites if required CT experienced desirable Patient care experience/skills Excellent interpersonal and organisation skills including time management Excellent communication and negotiating skills High energy level – able to collaborate across teams to achieve a common goal Ability to motivate self and other members of your team and appropriately delegate Positive approach to change Flexible approach to working hours

position: Rad Tech - Urgent Care; Southampton; Weekends
details: About the job Cooley Dickinson is the hospital where Radiologic Technologists can grow and accelerate their careers. We are seeking professionals who are committed to the highest quality patient care and will contribute to our on-going pursuit of excellence.  About Us  With energy and purpose, Cooley Dickinson Health Care, a member of the Mass General Brigham system, is advancing health care in western Massachusetts, and has been since 1886. Our network employs more than 2,000 medical professionals and support staff, at our main Hospital campus in Northampton and additional locations in twelve towns throughout the Pioneer Valley. Cooley Dickinson’s VNA & Hospice is also a vital part of our network, providing home-based services throughout Hampshire and Franklin counties.  Accolades and Recognition  Some Of These Awards Include  Our staff has been consistently recognized for the quality of care and commitment to patient safety provided on a daily basis.  Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)  5-star rating The American Association of Critical Care Nurses (AACN) Beacon Award for Excellence Human Rights Campaign Foundation LGBTQ+ Healthcare Equality Leader designation The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) awarded a Level 3 Geriatric Emergency Department Accreditation (GEDA) Baby-Friendly USA designated Baby-Friendly Hospital Newsweek Magazine and Statista named us one of the country’s Best Maternity Hospitals Cooley Dickinson has earned six consecutive ‘A’ Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade and the Top General Hospital award  Our Benefits  In addition to competitive pay, all Cooley Dickinson employees who work 20 hours or more per week have access to the following benefits with no waiting period:  a range of health, dental, vision, prescription and life insurance benefits  a generous and flexible Earned Time Off program starting at six weeks accrual per year  403(b) retirement plan with various investment options  opportunities and support for continued education including tuition reimbursement  The Radiologic Technologist is responsible for performing radiographic procedures using stationary, portable, and specialized equipment at a technical and professional level that does not require constant supervision and is of acceptable quality.  This position reports to the Supervisor, Diagnostic Radiology and operates within established organizational and departmental policies and procedures.  Minimum Requirements  Associate’s degree required. For those candidates who meet requirements of licensing and registration agencies and have been grandfathered by those agencies, Associate’s degree requirement may be waived, but a high school diploma or equivalent is required Current licensure by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and registry eligibility required; ARRT registration must be completed within six (6) months of hire. Continuing education credits must meet State and Registry Licensing requirements Current CPR certification required 1 year of experience preferred; technologists must be trained and capable of handling patients completely from invitro through adult  Primary Location  MA-Southampton-CDH Southampton Satellite  Work Locations  CDH Southampton Satellite  Job  X-Ray  Organization  Cooley Dickinson Hospital (CDH)  Schedule  Part-time  Standard Hours  8  Shift  Day Job  Posted Shift Description  8 hours per week every other weekend  Employee Status  Regular  Recruiting Department  CDH Urgent Care  Job Posting  Jun 5, 2023

About the job CTS Technologist - Industrial Team  We have an opportunity for someone to become part of the CTS Industrial team. The role will be providing support to customers via technical guidance and deliver solutions to meet the customers' needs and applications.  Developing a collaborative relationship with CTS, R&D, OEM, Sales, and Marketing to share and gain an understanding of current and future market trends, requirements and applications that will impact our product portfolio.  Bringing customers’ feedback in current technology to develop the future technology roadmap and be voice of customer in associated NPDs.  Be a key player within the Account Management Triangle (Sales, Marketing, CTS), and contributing to Customer Portfolio Analysis, enabling the team to great discovery to ensure recommendation and delivery of innovative solutions.  Develop insightful technical literature to support product portfolio for both internal and external customers.  Increase customer loyalty by proactively investigating and resolving customer concerns.  Develop understanding of Afton’s product line chemistry, OEM claims and applications.  Initiate development of a deep understanding of industry test requirements, customer test requirements and associated specifications and how those tests can be influenced by Afton chemistry.  Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering  Demonstrated aptitude for the CTS function.  Skills/ Abilities  Decision Making - Timely decision making using a mixture of analysis, experience, and judgment; sometimes with incomplete information, under tight deadlines with appropriate risk, authority and transparency Business Insight - Has knowledge of general business model, practices and procedures. Understands how the actions and output of the role impacts the business and others. Analysis and Problem Solving - Solves problems with effective solutions by asking good questions, involving others, and looking outside of existing processes and procedures. Has technical knowledge and skills to troubleshoot test equipment or test precision issues. Communication – Can communicate information clearly, effectively, and timely in an engaging and convincing manner. Managing Performance - Possessing the drive and focus to achieve challenging individual and team goals. Collaboration and Networking - The ability to work within and across Afton's organizational matrix to achieve objectives, including the capability to influence without authority. Project Management - The ability to manage tasks and activities and achieve their completion within the agreed framework, across regional and organizational boundaries as appropriate Innovation - Continuously assesses current processes, practices, procedures, techniques and tools and provides suggestions for improvement. Open to new concepts. May benchmark outside laboratories or others for process improvement ideas. Dealing with Uncertainty - Is sufficiently flexible to effectively cope with change, multiple priorities, and lack of information at times Customer Relationship Management – Interpersonal skills to be able to make good strong connections with customers & OEM personnel. Combination of character & technical credibility. Demonstrate customer intimacy and Passion for Solutions approach to understand core technical problems and deliver solutions to business, marketing and external customers.

This professionally trained person will be responsible for the operation of CT scanners, flow rate injectors, an EKG monitoring system, a picture archiving system. This position is responsible for the use of radiographic supplies including iodinated contrast while providing patient care and patient safety as established by department standards. This position is responsible for performing a variety of basic secretarial, clerical and housekeeping functions such as customer service, examination and work area cleaning, telephone communications, computer system data entry, information retrieval, (HIS, RIS, PACS), and infection control. This position, in addition to superb technical skills, will also require the ability to follow the CRMC service commitments to customers and fellow staff. Other duties as assigned. Position assures compliance and upholding of the Medical Center s policy of non-discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, physical or mental handicap, pregnancy or veteran status. Position may interact with all ages of patients, guests, staff and others. Education Associates Required Additional Education Requirements Certification, CT Required, And BLS Healthcare Provider Required Additional Certification Details Certified by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (ARRT) as a CT Technologist preferred. If not currently registered in CT, must obtain CT certification within one year of completing CT training. Experience Two years experience with all types of CT exams on multi-slice scanner is preferred. Operates Computerized Tomography scanners, flow regulated injectors, UPS systems, patient monitors, hospital computer systems and other associated medical imaging equipment. Have the ability to deal with patients, families and other hospital employees in a professional and caring manner in times of great stress and crises. Have the abilty tohandle constant pressure, stress and numerous interruptions associated with the busy schedule in the CT area. Job Requirements: Maintains Current Licensure/Certifications Attends Mandatory Meetings Attends at least 50% of unit meetings Reads 100% of meeting minutes not attended within 30 days Reads emails in a timely manner Completes Health Stream assignments on time Completes unit specific competencies in a timely manner Education Remains current on latest techniques and methods relative to CT exams. Demonstrates a willingness to learn new procedures and willingly accepts new responsibility. Performs other related duties as may be assigned or requested within the scope of education, skillsand/or experience Gives a copy of all continuing education, current ARRT and BLS cards to Chief CT Technologist. Knowledge of Job Continually keeps up to date with changes in protocols, procedures and scanning techniques. Demonstrates knowledge of day-to-day operations and organization of the CT area. Has knowledge of normal anatomy and basic pathology. Knows how and when to deviate protocols to best demonstrate unusual findings. Consistently demonstrates proper knowledge to safely adjust the complex physics of the CT scanners including; pitch, rotation time, table feed, filters/kernels and dose modulation. Understands and uses injector procedures and protocols in the safest manner. Always labels and accesses contrast according to proper technique. Is not wasteful and shares cost savings ideas. Patient care Always greets the patient by introducing self and calls patient by name. Verifies the appropriate patient by asking the patient their name, date of birth, and checking their armband. Completes patient procedure form and explains post procedure care to the patient. Explains the procedure to the patient and allows the patient time to ask questions. Always carefully observes patients during procedures listening for complaints and watching for unusual occurrences. Documents any problems that occur during the examination. Always notifies the Radiologist when patients are waiting for results. Communicates any problems with the procedures with the ordering physician and/or office staff. Ensures patients are reconnected to IV fluids, oxygen, and monitors prior to leaving the department, when applicable. Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n272643.

details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a Radiology Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: Radiology Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, flexible Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 3/27/2023 4/3/2023 4/10/2023 4/17/2023 TR ID 118920 Salary: $61,360.00 We have 5 open Full-Time Radiologic Technologist positions (shifts below). The pay range is $19.14-$29.50/hr., depending on experience as to where they fall at within the pay range. Saturday/Sunday 7a-9:30p, Monday 7p-7a (39 hours/week) Monday-Friday 1:30p-9:30p Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday 7p-6a, Friday 9:30p-6a (39 hours/week) Week 1: Monday-Thursday 8:30p-7a, Week 2: Friday-Sunday 5:30p-6a Week 1: Monday-Thursday 8:30p-7a, Week 2: Friday-Sunday 5:30p-6a We also offer a sign on bonus or loan forgiveness with a 2 year contract post orientation (with terms): 2+ years experience- $7,500 sign on bonus OR- up to $3,500 loan forgiveness with a 2 year contract post orientation Job Summary This position is responsible for working directly with patients and assisting radiologists and/or staff physicians while administering x-rays in the course of radiological examinations in concordance with physician orders. The radiologic technologist shall be capable of operating radiologic equipment, perform a variety of radiological procedures, operate the picture archiving system, use radiographic supplies including contrast while providing patient care and patient safety as established by department standards. This position is responsible for performing a variety of basic clerical and housekeeping functions such as examination and work area cleaning, telephone communications, computer system data entry, information retrieval (HIS, RIS, PACS), and infection control. The level I technologist shall be competent in the following areas: general radiography, routine fluoroscopy including barium studies, portable and emergent trauma radiography, radiographic technique formulation, radiographic quality control and basic surgical radiographic procedures. Level I technologists exercise professional judgment while performing services in a demeanor complimentary to customer service, age specific criteria, safety and medical ethics. Other duties as assigned. Position assures compliance and upholding of the Medical Center s policy of non-discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, physical or mental handicap, pregnancy or veteran status. Position may interact with all ages of patients, guests, staff and others. Education Associates Required Additional Education Requirements Graduate of an AMA approved School of Radiologic Technology. AAS or BS in Radiologic Sciences preferred. Radiological Technologist Required, And BLS Healthcare Provider Required Registered with the ARRT The candidate must successfully pass the national registry test for radiologic technology within 12 months from the start of being registry eligible. Experience Two years of Clinical experience in an ARRT accredited radiologic technology program. Additional on the job experience is preferred. Job Requirements: Maintains Current Licensure/Certifications Attends Mandatory Meetings Attends at least 50% of unit meetings Reads 100% of meeting minutes not attended within 30 days Reads emails in a timely manner Completes Health Stream assignments on time Completes unit specific competencies in a timely manner Technical/Job Skills Standards: Competently operates and understands basic operational features of radiographic equipment. Strives to assure all pertinent anatomy included on all radiographs and that proper positioning is obtained. Demonstrates knowledge of technical factor selection and manipulation for optimal radiograph exposure with minimal patient dose. Demonstrates knowledge of, and routinely performs, proper critique of radiographs to include, but not limited to; proper anatomical positioning, all pertinent anatomy included, proper technique, proper patient demographics, proper use of personalized position markers with evidence of collimation on views where applicable. Demonstrates knowledge of proper image processing ensuring successful transmission to PACS system. Sufficient knowledge of how to manage the PACS system to ensure correct patient/exam information is in the system. Demonstrates knowledge of use, and routinely utilizes, positioning aids, to obtain correct positioning of patient and to eliminate need for repeats due to motion, etc. Strives to maintain reject rate below department standard without sacrificing film quality on exams turned in for dictation. Asks for guidance from senior technologist if additional views would be beneficial. Assures all pertinent forms and documents are completed and sent to Medical Records (pregnancy forms, contrast criteria sheets, consent forms, etc). Demonstrates knowledge required for assisting and working with radiologists. Assures all supplies and exam room ready before calling for a radiologist. Ensures all images are in PACS correctly. Able to obtain vital signs and record as needed for procedures. Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n272649.  Benefits  Sign-On bonus

position: Permanent Allied Health Professional - CT Technologist
details: About the job Quality Clinicians Perm is seeking a CT Technologist for a job in 0, 0.  Job Description & Requirements  Specialty: CT Technologist Discipline: Allied Health Professional Start Date: ASAP Duration: Ongoing 40 hours per week Shift: 8 hours, nights Employment Type: Permanent  Potential Start Dates: 04/24/2023 5/8/2023 5/22/2023 6/5/2023 TR ID 107886 CT Technologist (Full-Time / Nights) Shift; 7p-730a Salary:$77,000.00 float applicable if requested by scheduling CT Technologist- Performs a variety of technical and patient care procedures that require independent judgment utilizing a multi-slice CT scanner. Utilizes power injectors and monitoring equipment. Starts IVs and administers IV, oral, or rectal contrast at the direction of the physician onsite. Provides exemplary customer service. Participates and is engaged in a team framework and maintains a positive approach and attitude. Continues to use their radiology technology experience doing diagnostic X-ray and Fluoroscopy work. Demonstrates complete understanding of multi-slice CT scan applications. Accurately provides diagnostic images and related functions. Demonstrates working knowledge of human anatomy to satisfactorily allow optimum positioning of patients for imaging procedure. Performs procedure in a manner which allows patients to be comfortable, both physically and emotionally. Demonstrates knowledge and application of radiation safety, use of protective devices and application of universal precaution techniques. Maintains up-to-date knowledge and information of current scan techniques. Enters exam data entry/charges in a manner consistent with department policy. Performs transporting of patients, file and/or reception duties as necessary. Maintains availability for on-call status per policy. Demonstrates ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities in an efficient manner. Demonstrates a good understanding of departmental operations and patient flow. Accurately prepares, dispenses, and administers (by injection, orally or rectally) all x-ray contrast in use in CT. Consistently follows departmental protocols and procedures. Obtains and documents relevant patient history to determine appropriateness of CT exam and communicates information to the radiologist. Demonstrates patient care skills appropriate for all age groups, neonate through geriatric and utilizes age specific imaging protocols. Consistently able to receive directions from the radiologist and apply good judgment. Is cooperative, respectful and helpful to all others in the workplace (co-workers, managers, and physicians) in support of the delivery of patient care and services. Conducts appropriate discussions regarding operational, system and personnel issues with the Lead Technologist or Medical Director. Demonstrates initiative to learn new or evolving procedures and practices in the CT department. Participates in promotion of services as necessary. Accepts instruction, guidance and corrections in a positive manner. Performs duties and functions appropriate to, and confines interactions (either verbal or written) with patients or other health care professionals, within the scope of practice of a CT technologist. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. This includes various types of x-ray equipment and applications, to include c-arm, portable, RF, etc. Proficiency with fluoroscopic procedures. Qualifications: Required qualifications for this position include: Successful completion of a program in Radiologic Technology as accepted by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists Current Washington State certification as a Radiologic Technologist Diagnostic license Basic Life Support (BLS) certification 1 year experience as a Radiologic Technologist Ability to take x-rays as needed. Required within 1 year of hire National Registered Technologist - Computed Tomography Or Required within 1 year of hire National Computed Tomography Technologist - Nuclear Medicine Technology Certification Board Preferred qualifications for this position include: CT experience Board registered by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) required, with Advanced Certification in Computed Tomography Program name:NuWest Travel  Quality Clinicians Perm Job ID #n266120.

About the job About The Role  We have a new opportunity for a PET-CT Radiographer/Technologist to join the team at our Turner Diagnostic Centre - Colchester.  You will ideally have a background in nuclear medicine and be experienced in handling and dispensing radiopharmaceuticals, although this would be a great opportunity for a Radiographer to develop in this modality.  Some experience in CT is also desirable but not essential for this role.  You will undertake a competency programme in PET-CT to develop your knowledge and help you gain a full understanding of PET-CT. Training will be delivered “On the Job” and in collaboration with the Christie School of Oncology via the PET-CT training academy. You will also be required to IV cannulate patients as part of the role. Rest assured, should you not have any prior experience in IV cannulation, Alliance Medical will provide full training.  Please note that we will be interviewing throughout the duration of this advert. Therefore if you are interested in this role an early application is advised as we may close the advert prior to the advertised date  About Alliance Medical  Alliance Medical are Europe’s leading independent provider of imaging services.  We combine service excellence and innovative imaging technologies to improve patient care and support NHS and independent organisations with their ongoing imaging requirements. Our approach has delivered consistent company growth for more than 30 years.  We live by our company values to ensure the highest level of patient care:  Our Values  Leaders, managers, and supervisors have a particular responsibility to be role models in terms of how they demonstrate these values themselves and how they engage their teams to work in this way.  Collaboration  We work together and in partnership for all our patients. We respect expertise and combine it to achieve more.  Excellence  We never compromise. We strive to deliver the very best in everything we do to ensure the highest quality of care. We treat our patients and each other with compassion, dignity and respect.  Learning  Knowledge and understanding comes from learning. At Alliance Medical we are committed to ensuring that each and every one of us keeps on learning and that we continuously look for improved ways of working.  Efficiency  Efficiency in healthcare means more patients get better care. We constantly seek new ways to use the scarce resource of healthcare more intelligently so that more people can live longer, fuller lives.  Openness  We act with transparency and honesty in everything we do, where staff are encouraged to speak up to ensure a safe and secure environment for our patients.  Skills And Experience  The successful candidate must have:  BSc/DCR in Diagnostic Radiography and/or Diploma in Nuclear Medicine or equivalent Awareness of, and compliance with Alliance Medical Policies and Procedures, Radiation Regulations (IRMER, IRR 99 and EPR 2010) if modality requires this, CQC requirements and Health and Safety legislation Awareness of, and compliance with Data Protection and Patient confidentiality  And to be prepared to Undertake initial and refresher mandatory training to ensure compliance at all times.  While Being Able To Demonstrate  Experience and knowledge in area of expertise desired but not essential Experienced in PET-CT an advantage IV Cannulation Certificate preferred-training will be provided Must be IT literate Enhanced DBS clearance required Flexibility to operate across multiple sites if required CT experienced desirable Patient care experience/skills Excellent interpersonal and organisation skills including time management Excellent communication and negotiating skills High energy level – able to collaborate across teams to achieve a common goal Ability to motivate self and other members of your team and appropriately delegate Positive approach to change Flexible approach to working hours

position: Rad Tech - Urgent Care; Southampton; Weekends
details: About the job Cooley Dickinson is the hospital where Radiologic Technologists can grow and accelerate their careers. We are seeking professionals who are committed to the highest quality patient care and will contribute to our on-going pursuit of excellence.  About Us  With energy and purpose, Cooley Dickinson Health Care, a member of the Mass General Brigham system, is advancing health care in western Massachusetts, and has been since 1886. Our network employs more than 2,000 medical professionals and support staff, at our main Hospital campus in Northampton and additional locations in twelve towns throughout the Pioneer Valley. Cooley Dickinson’s VNA & Hospice is also a vital part of our network, providing home-based services throughout Hampshire and Franklin counties.  Accolades and Recognition  Some Of These Awards Include  Our staff has been consistently recognized for the quality of care and commitment to patient safety provided on a daily basis.  Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)  5-star rating The American Association of Critical Care Nurses (AACN) Beacon Award for Excellence Human Rights Campaign Foundation LGBTQ+ Healthcare Equality Leader designation The American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) awarded a Level 3 Geriatric Emergency Department Accreditation (GEDA) Baby-Friendly USA designated Baby-Friendly Hospital Newsweek Magazine and Statista named us one of the country’s Best Maternity Hospitals Cooley Dickinson has earned six consecutive ‘A’ Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade and the Top General Hospital award  Our Benefits  In addition to competitive pay, all Cooley Dickinson employees who work 20 hours or more per week have access to the following benefits with no waiting period:  a range of health, dental, vision, prescription and life insurance benefits  a generous and flexible Earned Time Off program starting at six weeks accrual per year  403(b) retirement plan with various investment options  opportunities and support for continued education including tuition reimbursement  The Radiologic Technologist is responsible for performing radiographic procedures using stationary, portable, and specialized equipment at a technical and professional level that does not require constant supervision and is of acceptable quality.  This position reports to the Supervisor, Diagnostic Radiology and operates within established organizational and departmental policies and procedures.  Minimum Requirements  Associate’s degree required. For those candidates who meet requirements of licensing and registration agencies and have been grandfathered by those agencies, Associate’s degree requirement may be waived, but a high school diploma or equivalent is required Current licensure by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts and registry eligibility required; ARRT registration must be completed within six (6) months of hire. Continuing education credits must meet State and Registry Licensing requirements Current CPR certification required 1 year of experience preferred; technologists must be trained and capable of handling patients completely from invitro through adult  Primary Location  MA-Southampton-CDH Southampton Satellite  Work Locations  CDH Southampton Satellite  Job  X-Ray  Organization  Cooley Dickinson Hospital (CDH)  Schedule  Part-time  Standard Hours  8  Shift  Day Job  Posted Shift Description  8 hours per week every other weekend  Employee Status  Regular  Recruiting Department  CDH Urgent Care  Job Posting  Jun 5, 2023

About the job CTS Technologist - Industrial Team  We have an opportunity for someone to become part of the CTS Industrial team. The role will be providing support to customers via technical guidance and deliver solutions to meet the customers' needs and applications.  Developing a collaborative relationship with CTS, R&D, OEM, Sales, and Marketing to share and gain an understanding of current and future market trends, requirements and applications that will impact our product portfolio.  Bringing customers’ feedback in current technology to develop the future technology roadmap and be voice of customer in associated NPDs.  Be a key player within the Account Management Triangle (Sales, Marketing, CTS), and contributing to Customer Portfolio Analysis, enabling the team to great discovery to ensure recommendation and delivery of innovative solutions.  Develop insightful technical literature to support product portfolio for both internal and external customers.  Increase customer loyalty by proactively investigating and resolving customer concerns.  Develop understanding of Afton’s product line chemistry, OEM claims and applications.  Initiate development of a deep understanding of industry test requirements, customer test requirements and associated specifications and how those tests can be influenced by Afton chemistry.  Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering  Demonstrated aptitude for the CTS function.  Skills/ Abilities  Decision Making - Timely decision making using a mixture of analysis, experience, and judgment; sometimes with incomplete information, under tight deadlines with appropriate risk, authority and transparency Business Insight - Has knowledge of general business model, practices and procedures. Understands how the actions and output of the role impacts the business and others. Analysis and Problem Solving - Solves problems with effective solutions by asking good questions, involving others, and looking outside of existing processes and procedures. Has technical knowledge and skills to troubleshoot test equipment or test precision issues. Communication – Can communicate information clearly, effectively, and timely in an engaging and convincing manner. Managing Performance - Possessing the drive and focus to achieve challenging individual and team goals. Collaboration and Networking - The ability to work within and across Afton's organizational matrix to achieve objectives, including the capability to influence without authority. Project Management - The ability to manage tasks and activities and achieve their completion within the agreed framework, across regional and organizational boundaries as appropriate Innovation - Continuously assesses current processes, practices, procedures, techniques and tools and provides suggestions for improvement. Open to new concepts. May benchmark outside laboratories or others for process improvement ideas. Dealing with Uncertainty - Is sufficiently flexible to effectively cope with change, multiple priorities, and lack of information at times Customer Relationship Management – Interpersonal skills to be able to make good strong connections with customers & OEM personnel. Combination of character & technical credibility. Demonstrate customer intimacy and Passion for Solutions approach to understand core technical problems and deliver solutions to business, marketing and external customers.

This professionally trained person will be responsible for the operation of MRI scanners, flow rate injectors, patient monitoring systems, and a picture archiving system.
